Useable Toilets, Urinals, and Bathtubs - with sound fx V.5 This archive contains 2 esp files UseableToilets.esp UseableToiletsUninstall.esp Only use the first one if you are installing the mod, the second esp is for uninstalling and replacing toilets disabled by the first. This mod requires the latest version of NVSE You can download NVSE here http://nvse.silverlock.org/ ---------- Important ---------- Please reset hardcore mode using the Toilet Paper item by turning it off, then back on. This will help prevent problems as some of the timers used in the mod have changed. ------------ Description New Hardcore mode added, see change log below for details! ------------ This mod adds an inventory item called Toilet Paper to the aid section of the pip boy. When you enter a new cell, or find a fixture that you want to replace click the Toilet Paper and select the desired option. If you are replacing toilets in your own home, or somewhere you wouldn't expect to find random NPCs using the toilets, select the add toilets to my home option. Sit on toilets will play a flushing sound when you or an NPC get up from them and walk away. Urinals will play an unzip sound, peeing sound, and zip sound when used. To use a urinal simply walk up to it very close. Urinals are only for male characters, sorry ladies. Tubs can sit two people. They will unequip your clothing, if you are wearing any, and play enter and leave splashing sounds. Upon leaving your clothing will be re-equipped. Placeable tubs will only do the above for the player due to some placement limitations. Replaced tube will do the above for the player and one companion, if two companions are in the tub only the first one entering will be affected. If you decide you don't want the placeable tub anymore open console, click it to show its id at the top of the screen and type, disable followed by the enter key, then MarkForDelete followed by the enter key. Repeat the process for the water mesh. Companions with a sit option can use toilets. ------ Notes ----- Why create this mod when at least one other mod with sit on toilets exists? When I came across these meshes I thought it was a good idea. Who wants to drink from a dirty toilet anyway? The mods I saw were replacer mods where the mod authors went in and hand replaced the old toilets with the sit on type. That can cause conflicts with other mods that change cells obviously, plus it doesn't affect newly created cells from other mods. After the initial release for FO3 I included usable urinals, and bathtubs. Even added placeable bathtubs that you can purchase from the merchant in the GoodSprings General Store. The items are called Dirty Tub, Clean Tub, and Cleanest Tub, and sell for 300, 600, and 1000 caps respectively. Tubs weigh 50lbs to add some realism (yes I know a cast iron tub like this would actually be a few hundred pounds). To place a purchased tub Drop the item from the misc scetion of your inventory. The tub can then be placed using the z key. Once in position enter sneak mode and activate the tub to set yout new useable two person tub. Tubs, the placeable kind and the replacements for existing tubs are scaled up a bit (to avoid some clipping, feet still stick through the bottom, sorry best I can do) so keep this in mind when placing them. My approach, while a little more combersome, allows for greater compatability along with support for other mods. -------- Warning -------- This mod will disable existing toilets and tubs and replace them with the useable variety. Uninstalling this mod will leave you with an empty spot where they used to be. Be sure to activate the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp to replace those toilets, and leave it installed until you are sure all have been re-enabled. ----------- Change Log ----------- 8-26-12: Changed the timers concerning the pee time variable. The new timer gives 12 hpurs before any warnings, then an additional warning each 3 hours. At the 21 hour mark an accident will happen if you do not find a toilet or use the No Pee chem. Be sure to reset hardcore mode using the Toilet Paper item to ensure the new timers are activated properly. Added out houses as useable toilets. They function just like other toilets from this mod, but do not use the flushing sound. These out houses just have a script attached to the base object, so no need to run the Toilet Paper replacer function, they should work when activated. Also added the Ultra Lux toilets to the replacer script, as it was pointed out I missed them in previous versions. Lastly I added the ability to bathe in bodies of water, providing you have some Abraxo cleaner. To bathe in water bring up the pipboy and find the Toilet Paper aid item. Hole the zoom button (which should inform you that you can not drop quest items) And left click the Toilet Paper while still holding zoom. If you are in the water your armor should be removed, and the script will run just like in a bath tub cleaning the dirt over time. Only natural water bodies will work, not placeable water. Previous update: Two new items are added to the camp fire menu No-Pee No-Poo Each of these items will extend the time until your next bathroom visit. When using them your timer will be reset, but agailty penalty will remain until you find and use a toilet. Currently each recipe requires a dirty water, and either Broc Flower (for pee) or xander root (for poo). 5-22-12: Added an option to bind a hot key (of your selection) to display your current bathroom timers and mod penalties. Only available in hardcore mode obviously. If you elect not to bind a key, or later wish to change the key you selected, just restart hardcore mode. 5-14-12: Small change to the toilet script to prevent ladies from getting stuck while going No1. Previously pressing a directional control caused the script to halt leaving the player in a restrained state. Changed it to disable player controls while the sound is playing to avoid the issue. You will still not be able to get up until the sound stops, or a couple seconds after. 5-10-12: Fixed a couple script errors I found. Namely the dirt variable tracking, and the start/stop hardcore option. Should both work right now. Also found an interesting bug where the cha variable gats stored as -0.00, you can see this in the show stats option after you have restored charisma previously damaged from dirt. The game throws out this negative zero, then doesn't know quite how to deal with it. I was able to get around the issue, but I find it interesting so I thought would mention it. 5-9-12: Two new items, Fancy Shampoo, and Bath Beads. Both are sold by Old Lady Gibson, and the Street Vendor on the the Vegas Strip. When sold out they will restock in 7 game days. Having these items in your inventory while bathing will grant the Fresh Scent bouns, which boosts Charisma by 1 for 6 or 12 hours depending on if you have one or both items. Fixed a bug where toilet sounds still played when pressing fire button even after getting up from the toilet. Added splash sound when pressing the fire button while in tubs. 5-06-12: New Hardcore mode added.Not dependent on Hardcore mode selection in the game. Default is turned on, but you can turn it off in the toilet paper options menu if you prefer. Players will have to use toilets, and tubs based on a time scale. Peeing will need to be done once every 9 hours to avoid having an accident. At the 6 hour mark a message will be displayed "you need to pee 1", and your agility will be decreased by 1. At 7 hours a message saying "you need to pee 2", accompanied by another loss of 1 agility. * hour mark "you need to pee 3" agility -1. This is a total agility loss of 3 at this point. At the 9 hour mark a message saying "you wet yourself" will be displayed. At that point agility will return to normal, and your charisma will drop by .2 Peeing anytime before you wet yourself will reset agility, if any is lost, and reset the timer Potty will have to be done once every 33 hours to avoid having an accident. Potty is treated the same as pee accept the times are 24, 27, 30, and 33. Each is accompanied by the -1 agility with the 33 mark restoring agility and decreasing charisma by 1. Bathing will need to be done once a day to avoid a loss in character Charisma.It is handled on the same time scale as potty where 24 hours you get your first message that you need to bathe. Then every 3 hours you will get the message again. The first message results in a chariama drop of 1, and each following message at the 3 hour intervals results in an additional .2 loss to charisma. The dirt variable is used to track your total charisma loss due to having accidents, and not bathing. every point of dirt is equal to -.2 charisma. Bathing is the only way to remove dirt and restore your charisma. While bathing you will restore .2 charisma every second you are in the tub. When dirt has been completely removed you will get a message box saying you are clean. There are two items you will need to have in your inventory to use the toilets and tubs efficently. One is lottery tickets (for toilet paper) the other is abraxo cleaner (for tub bathing). Both of these items have been added to varions merchants throughout New Vegas and they will restock a few seconds after they run out. A full box of cleaner will remove about 60 dirt, and one lotto ticket will be used when using the toilets. Male characters only consume TP when going potty. The menu has changed to add a few new options, and consolidate the old options. New is show status which will display the time you have to pee, potty, and bathe. It also displays your total dirt, charisma and agility penalties. There is also an option to turn off/restart the needs part of the mod. When turning off the feature your agility and charisma should be restored if they were lowered. Sleeping will suspend your timers, so you shouldn't get any dirtier or have any accidents while sleeping. Waiting or fast travel on the other hand won't suspend the timers, so plan accordingly. When players select to potty on a toilet they will need to press the attack/fire button at least once while seated. Failure to do so will result in the player not registering as having pottied. So don't be shy, fire away! When the mod is first loaded it may take 2 to 3 minutes for some merchants to get their supply of lottery tickets and abraxo cleaner. Not every merchant will stock these items but I will tell you that chett at the good springs general store does. He is at the very bottom of the list though so it will take multiple iterations of the quest script for him to receive his supply. All of this is subject to change at any time. 4-29-12: Removed TribalPack.esm dependency -------- Credits -------- This mod uses modified toilet meshes created by coneman at the Nexus web sites. ------------- Installation ------------- Extract the contents of this archive to the Fallout NV folder. Select the UseableToilets.esp in the data files section, and launch the game. ------------- unistalling ------------- Deselect the UseableToilets.esp and select the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp in the data files section. Keep the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp checked until all toilets have been replaced. If after that you find missing toilets just recheck the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp and re-enter the cell where you noticed them missing. The cell will have to load so you may need to change cells then come back. Some of the static items are replaced as soon as this esp is activated, so place it as low as possible in the load order the first time it is run. After that you can move it higher if you need to.

Both are sold by Old Lady Gibson, and the Street Vendor on the the Vegas Strip. When sold out they will restock in 7 game days. Having these items in your inventory while bathing will grant the Fresh Scent bouns, which boosts Charisma by 1 for 6 or 12 hours depending on if you have one or both items. Fixed a bug where toilet sounds still played when pressing fire button even after getting up from the toilet. Added splash sound when pressing the fire button while in tubs. 5-06-12: New Hardcore mode added.Not dependent on Hardcore mode selection in the game. Default is turned on, but you can turn it off in the toilet paper options menu if you prefer. Players will have to use toilets, and tubs based on a time scale. Peeing will need to be done once every 9 hours to avoid having an accident. At the 6 hour mark a message will be displayed \"you need to pee 1\", and your agility will be decreased by 1. At 7 hours a message saying \"you need to pee 2\", accompanied by another loss of 1 agility. * hour mark \"you need to pee 3\" agility -1. This is a total agility loss of 3 at this point. At the 9 hour mark a message saying \"you wet yourself\" will be displayed. At that point agility will return to normal, and your charisma will drop by .2 Peeing anytime before you wet yourself will reset agility, if any is lost, and reset the timer Potty will have to be done once every 33 hours to avoid having an accident. Potty is treated the same as pee accept the times are 24, 27, 30, and 33. Each is accompanied by the -1 agility with the 33 mark restoring agility and decreasing charisma by 1. Bathing will need to be done once a day to avoid a loss in character Charisma.It is handled on the same time scale as potty where 24 hours you get your first message that you need to bathe. Then every 3 hours you will get the message again. The first message results in a chariama drop of 1, and each following message at the 3 hour intervals results in an additional .2 loss to charisma. The dirt variable is used to track your total charisma loss due to having accidents, and not bathing. every point of dirt is equal to -.2 charisma. Bathing is the only way to remove dirt and restore your charisma. While bathing you will restore .2 charisma every second you are in the tub. When dirt has been completely removed you will get a message box saying you are clean. There are two items you will need to have in your inventory to use the toilets and tubs efficently. One is lottery tickets (for toilet paper) the other is abraxo cleaner (for tub bathing). Both of these items have been added to varions merchants throughout New Vegas and they will restock a few seconds after they run out. A full box of cleaner will remove about 60 dirt, and one lotto ticket will be used when using the toilets. Male characters only consume TP when going potty. The menu has changed to add a few new options, and consolidate the old options. New is show status which will display the time you have to pee, potty, and bathe. It also displays your total dirt, charisma and agility penalties. There is also an option to turn off/restart the needs part of the mod. When turning off the feature your agility and charisma should be restored if they were lowered. Sleeping will suspend your timers, so you shouldn\'t get any dirtier or have any accidents while sleeping. Waiting or fast travel on the other hand won\'t suspend the timers, so plan accordingly. When players select to potty on a toilet they will need to press the attack/fire button at least once while seated. Failure to do so will result in the player not registering as having pottied. So don\'t be shy, fire away! When the mod is first loaded it may take 2 to 3 minutes for some merchants to get their supply of lottery tickets and abraxo cleaner. Not every merchant will stock these items but I will tell you that chett at the good springs general store does. He is at the very bottom of the list though so it will take multiple iterations of the quest script for him to receive his supply. All of this is subject to change at any time. 4-29-12: Removed TribalPack.esm dependency -------- Credits -------- This mod uses modified toilet meshes created by coneman at the Nexus web sites. ------------- Installation ------------- Extract the contents of this archive to the Fallout NV folder. Select the UseableToilets.esp in the data files section, and launch the game. ------------- unistalling ------------- Deselect the UseableToilets.esp and select the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp in the data files section. Keep the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp checked until all toilets have been replaced. If after that you find missing toilets just recheck the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp and re-enter the cell where you noticed them missing. The cell will have to load so you may need to change cells then come back. Some of the static items are replaced as soon as this esp is activated, so place it as low as possible in the load order the first time it is run. After that you can move it higher if you need to.

Be sure to reset hardcore mode using the Toilet Paper item to ensure the new timers are activated properly. Added out houses as useable toilets. They function just like other toilets from this mod, but do not use the flushing sound. These out houses just have a script attached to the base object, so no need to run the Toilet Paper replacer function, they should work when activated. Also added the Ultra Lux toilets to the replacer script, as it was pointed out I missed them in previous versions. Lastly I added the ability to bathe in bodies of water, providing you have some Abraxo cleaner. To bathe in water bring up the pipboy and find the Toilet Paper aid item. Hole the zoom button (which should inform you that you can not drop quest items) And left click the Toilet Paper while still holding zoom. If you are in the water your armor should be removed, and the script will run just like in a bath tub cleaning the dirt over time. Only natural water bodies will work, not placeable water. Previous update: Two new items are added to the camp fire menu No-Pee No-Poo Each of these items will extend the time until your next bathroom visit. When using them your timer will be reset, but agailty penalty will remain until you find and use a toilet. Currently each recipe requires a dirty water, and either Broc Flower (for pee) or xander root (for poo). 5-22-12: Added an option to bind a hot key (of your selection) to display your current bathroom timers and mod penalties. Only available in hardcore mode obviously. If you elect not to bind a key, or later wish to change the key you selected, just restart hardcore mode. 5-14-12: Small change to the toilet script to prevent ladies from getting stuck while going No1. Previously pressing a directional control caused the script to halt leaving the player in a restrained state. Changed it to disable player controls while the sound is playing to avoid the issue. You will still not be able to get up until the sound stops, or a couple seconds after. 5-10-12: Fixed a couple script errors I found. Namely the dirt variable tracking, and the start/stop hardcore option. Should both work right now. Also found an interesting bug where the cha variable gats stored as -0.00, you can see this in the show stats option after you have restored charisma previously damaged from dirt. The game throws out this negative zero, then doesn\'t know quite how to deal with it. I was able to get around the issue, but I find it interesting so I thought would mention it. 5-9-12: Two new items, Fancy Shampoo, and Bath Beads. Both are sold by Old Lady Gibson, and the Street Vendor on the the Vegas Strip. When sold out they will restock in 7 game days. Having these items in your inventory while bathing will grant the Fresh Scent bouns, which boosts Charisma by 1 for 6 or 12 hours depending on if you have one or both items. Fixed a bug where toilet sounds still played when pressing fire button even after getting up from the toilet. Added splash sound when pressing the fire button while in tubs. 5-06-12: New Hardcore mode added.Not dependent on Hardcore mode selection in the game. Default is turned on, but you can turn it off in the toilet paper options menu if you prefer. Players will have to use toilets, and tubs based on a time scale. Peeing will need to be done once every 9 hours to avoid having an accident. At the 6 hour mark a message will be displayed \"you need to pee 1\", and your agility will be decreased by 1. At 7 hours a message saying \"you need to pee 2\", accompanied by another loss of 1 agility. * hour mark \"you need to pee 3\" agility -1. This is a total agility loss of 3 at this point. At the 9 hour mark a message saying \"you wet yourself\" will be displayed. At that point agility will return to normal, and your charisma will drop by .2 Peeing anytime before you wet yourself will reset agility, if any is lost, and reset the timer Potty will have to be done once every 33 hours to avoid having an accident. Potty is treated the same as pee accept the times are 24, 27, 30, and 33. Each is accompanied by the -1 agility with the 33 mark restoring agility and decreasing charisma by 1. Bathing will need to be done once a day to avoid a loss in character Charisma.It is handled on the same time scale as potty where 24 hours you get your first message that you need to bathe. Then every 3 hours you will get the message again. The first message results in a chariama drop of 1, and each following message at the 3 hour intervals results in an additional .2 loss to charisma. The dirt variable is used to track your total charisma loss due to having accidents, and not bathing. every point of dirt is equal to -.2 charisma. Bathing is the only way to remove dirt and restore your charisma. While bathing you will restore .2 charisma every second you are in the tub. When dirt has been completely removed you will get a message box saying you are clean. There are two items you will need to have in your inventory to use the toilets and tubs efficently. One is lottery tickets (for toilet paper) the other is abraxo cleaner (for tub bathing). Both of these items have been added to varions merchants throughout New Vegas and they will restock a few seconds after they run out. A full box of cleaner will remove about 60 dirt, and one lotto ticket will be used when using the toilets. Male characters only consume TP when going potty. The menu has changed to add a few new options, and consolidate the old options. New is show status which will display the time you have to pee, potty, and bathe. It also displays your total dirt, charisma and agility penalties. There is also an option to turn off/restart the needs part of the mod. When turning off the feature your agility and charisma should be restored if they were lowered. Sleeping will suspend your timers, so you shouldn\'t get any dirtier or have any accidents while sleeping. Waiting or fast travel on the other hand won\'t suspend the timers, so plan accordingly. When players select to potty on a toilet they will need to press the attack/fire button at least once while seated. Failure to do so will result in the player not registering as having pottied. So don\'t be shy, fire away! When the mod is first loaded it may take 2 to 3 minutes for some merchants to get their supply of lottery tickets and abraxo cleaner. Not every merchant will stock these items but I will tell you that chett at the good springs general store does. He is at the very bottom of the list though so it will take multiple iterations of the quest script for him to receive his supply. All of this is subject to change at any time. 4-29-12: Removed TribalPack.esm dependency -------- Credits -------- This mod uses modified toilet meshes created by coneman at the Nexus web sites. ------------- Installation ------------- Extract the contents of this archive to the Fallout NV folder. Select the UseableToilets.esp in the data files section, and launch the game. ------------- unistalling ------------- Deselect the UseableToilets.esp and select the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp in the data files section. Keep the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp checked until all toilets have been replaced. If after that you find missing toilets just recheck the UseableToiletsUninstall.esp and re-enter the cell where you noticed them missing. The cell will have to load so you may need to change cells then come back. Some of the static items are replaced as soon as this esp is activated, so place it as low as possible in the load order the first time it is run. After that you can move it higher if you need to.

http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=39024 Includes: ------------------------------------------------------------ Ingestibles Beer (all varieties) adds a nuka cola cap after being drunk. Various sodas (Nuka, variants, sarparilla) increases thirst more, and also increase hunger slightly. Xander root value changed from 0 to 2. Ammo * MicroBreeder ammo given minimal weight, and no longer has DT bypass effect given by last official patch. Armor Surgical Mask weight reduced from 1 to .05 Makeshift gas mask replaces eyeglasses, mask ,a nd mouth objects, and also has a gas-mask effect that appears to have been intended by FNV designers but not installed. Chinese Stealth suit now has FO3-style stealth field, value and health hugely increased. New generic Petro-Chico jumpsuit added to loot lists. NPC classes Doctors now sell much more stuff. Bartenders now also sell clothing. Mechanics now hve Repair tag skill, not Lockpicking. Gun Merchants sell misc items. Addicts enable to sell chems. Adventurer Vendors now sell misc items and do repairs. Travelling merchants now do repairs. Containers and Merchant Inventories Huge numbers of items added to various miscellabous containers, including chances of: schematics skill books magazines weapon mods Creatures Numerous changes to animal factions and agressiveness. Dogs no longer in AnimalFriendFaction, look nastier, hev better AI for hunting behaviors. Ravens now preferentially look for human flesh :). Feral Ghouls wearing jumpsuits now have jumpsuit in loot. Object Effects Stun grenades now also paralyse, in addition to stun effect. Gas grenades now create a poison gas cloud, have nastier explosions. Factions Numerous changes to who\'s in what factions, and relations between factions. NCR Faction now enemies with various wastelasn critters, like rats, scorpions, geckos, lakelurks. Great Khans no longer enemies of NCR. Primm residents now enemies of bloatflys and geckos. Dogs now enemies of lots of other creatures, such as ghouls, supermutantsm robots, raiders, etc. Basically they now go after everyone, it seems. Mojave Civilians now enemies of creatures, powder gangers, and jackals. Vipers and Jackals now attack lots of creatures on sight. Mojave Mercenaties now allies of Novac/Primm/188, enemies of ghouls, supermutants, creatures, fiends. Game Settings Max level upped to 99. Leveled Items Numerous changes to level lists, mostly adding new loot, including a few unbalancing ones: Skill books now buyable at vendors, at cost of 50 caps base. Holy Frag grenades can be found in loot. Misc Items Numerous weight changes, most reasonable reductions and giving some weight to 0 weight items. Poweder, primer, and cases now have weight. Notes Lots of fun new notes (junk mail, love letters) added to mailboxes. NPCs Numerous NPC changes, including voices, inventories, and AI packages. Companions level up at 1.0x player level (not 0.75 as in last official patch), max level 99. Chris Haversham now has Novac work/sleep AI. Residents of various places (Primm, Goodsprings) now have vastly increased AI, including putting on nighties to go to bed, eating breakfast, finding weapons and ammo and clothes. NCR Troopers have enchanced assualt and guard AI. All legionaries have Legion Ears as death items. Doctor Michelle Lee added to Primm. AI Packages Nost NPCs put on nightwear before sleeping. Most NPCs restore health after sleeping NPCs actaully use food to eat. Quest Fixes for VMS02 \'I fought the Law\' Weapons Sniper Rifle damage restored to 62, not 42 as changed in last official patch. Sniper Rifle does a Miss Foutune kncokdown on critical. Boone\'s Scoped hunting rifle now playable, has scope, cases head explosion on critical. Binoculars always have Rex\' \'search and mark\' ability. Gas Grenades cause paralysis. Miss Fortune\'s Bad Luck Bringer damge now 25, not 10. WeapKnifeAssassin name changed from \'Combat Knife\' (one of many) to \'Assassin Knife\', abd given poison effect. (NOTE: poison effect fails to work in my game, says \'cannot be applied to thrown object\'.) Gobi Campaign Scout Rifle now has nightvision scope. Incendiary Grenade criticals now same as flamer crits, rather than plasma gooification. Stun Grenade criticals cause Mezz effect rather than plasma gooification. Holy Frag Grenade crits cause MissFortune BlowUp effect. Stun Baton crits cause Mezz effect rather than Flamer effect.

Dialog Some fixes to NPC passing comments regarding Primm Doctor dialogs changed to include new Primm doctor. Lorenzo in Hidden Valley will do repairs. Object Effects Stun grenades now also paralyse, in addition to stun effect. Gas grenades now create a poison gas cloud, have nastier explosions. Factions Numerous changes to who\'s in what factions, and relations between factions. NCR Faction now enemies with various wastelasn critters, like rats, scorpions, geckos, lakelurks. Great Khans no longer enemies of NCR. Primm residents now enemies of bloatflys and geckos. Dogs now enemies of lots of other creatures, such as ghouls, supermutantsm robots, raiders, etc. Basically they now go after everyone, it seems. Mojave Civilians now enemies of creatures, powder gangers, and jackals. Vipers and Jackals now attack lots of creatures on sight. Mojave Mercenaties now allies of Novac/Primm/188, enemies of ghouls, supermutants, creatures, fiends. Game Settings Max level upped to 99. Leveled Items Numerous changes to level lists, mostly adding new loot, including a few unbalancing ones: Skill books now buyable at vendors, at cost of 50 caps base. Holy Frag grenades can be found in loot. Misc Items Numerous weight changes, most reasonable reductions and giving some weight to 0 weight items. Poweder, primer, and cases now have weight. Notes Lots of fun new notes (junk mail, love letters) added to mailboxes. NPCs Numerous NPC changes, including voices, inventories, and AI packages. Companions level up at 1.0x player level (not 0.75 as in last official patch), max level 99. Chris Haversham now has Novac work/sleep AI. Residents of various places (Primm, Goodsprings) now have vastly increased AI, including putting on nighties to go to bed, eating breakfast, finding weapons and ammo and clothes. NCR Troopers have enchanced assualt and guard AI. All legionaries have Legion Ears as death items. Doctor Michelle Lee added to Primm. AI Packages Nost NPCs put on nightwear before sleeping. Most NPCs restore health after sleeping NPCs actaully use food to eat. Quest Fixes for VMS02 \'I fought the Law\' Weapons Sniper Rifle damage restored to 62, not 42 as changed in last official patch. Sniper Rifle does a Miss Foutune kncokdown on critical. Boone\'s Scoped hunting rifle now playable, has scope, cases head explosion on critical. Binoculars always have Rex\' \'search and mark\' ability. Gas Grenades cause paralysis. Miss Fortune\'s Bad Luck Bringer damge now 25, not 10. WeapKnifeAssassin name changed from \'Combat Knife\' (one of many) to \'Assassin Knife\', abd given poison effect. (NOTE: poison effect fails to work in my game, says \'cannot be applied to thrown object\'.) Gobi Campaign Scout Rifle now has nightvision scope. Incendiary Grenade criticals now same as flamer crits, rather than plasma gooification. Stun Grenade criticals cause Mezz effect rather than plasma gooification. Holy Frag Grenade crits cause MissFortune BlowUp effect. Stun Baton crits cause Mezz effect rather than Flamer effect.

http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=44476 [img]http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/images/55918-1345420888.png[/img] [B] Breeze body patch is not fully updated, but it works with the new patch now. Breeze patch does NOT currently support: - Meshes optimized - Wound decal compatibility - Pipboy compatibility [/B] ========== Updates ========== 1.1: - Added missing effect textures - Fixed paths of some effects - Rayban meshes edited to help clipping - Cheater patch added - Fixed vanilla ground meshes from showing if female - Removed modulates voice from Shemagh ---------------------------- 1.0: - Meshes optimized - Textures optimized - New leather backpack texture - Environment masks added to some items - Rebalanced items - All new ground meshes for all items - New icons - Wound decal compatibility - Pipboy compatibility - Skin fixes - Removed Pickelhaube helmets - Removed Wasteland Survivor - Removed Vault Scientist\'s Glove - Name changes - New level lists - Removed Diversified Mojave Wasteland requirement - Added Diversified Mojave Wasteland patch - Added Project Nevada patch - New Readme format =========== Description =========== I was always put off by the fact that 90% of the population seemed to wear the exact same armor/clothing with the exact same hat as everyone else, the end of the world may have happened but that doesn\'t mean everyone found and wears the exact same piece of clothing. This mod aims to try and lessen this issue by adding more clothing/armor variety into the wasteland through the use of level lists. This mod includes: Backpacks: 11 Gloves: 21 Headgear: 47 Armors/Clothing: 29 Poncho: 7 ============ Requirements ============ Fallout New Vegas patch: 1.4.0.525 Any Type3/Type6 Female Body: http://www.newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=34825 Robert Male Body: http://www.newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=39880 OR Breezes New Vegas Males: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/35451 ---------------------- Optional but suggested: ---------------------- Wrye Flash NV (for a bashed patch): http://www.newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=35003 or FNVEdit (for a merged patch): http://www.newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=34703 ========== Plugins ========== If you are updating from 0.7 to version 1.0, you do not NEED to make a clean save but I highly suggest you do so. To make a clean save you need to, find a safe indoor spot (no enemy respawns) and save. Now uninstall the mod, and load the save. save again. Now install the mod. Wait inside for 4 days so everyone\'s level lists can reset. If you do NOT do a clean save, please try and remove any Pickelhaube Helmets and Wasteland Survivor outfit from your inventory or your companion\'s inventory before updating. Wait inside for 4 days so everyones level lists can reset after updating. ---------------- Main plugins: ---------------- 1nivVSLArmors.esp: This is the main plugin, it places items through out the game in level lists/vendors. --------------------------- Optional player only plugin: --------------------------- DO NOT USE this with the Diversified Mojave Wasteland patch. Player only version: This is the player only version, it places the armors in boxes you find in Goodsprings and in vendors. There are no items found in level lists. ------------------- Optional Patches: ------------------- Optional patches require BOTH Spice Of Life AND the mod they patch to be installed and/or turned on. ................ Cheater Patch ................ 1nivVSLArmors Cheat.esp: This is a patch that adds four boxes to Goodsprings, for those who want to cheat to get the items but also want the level list edits of the Main plugin. DO NOT USE this with the Optional player only plugin. ................................................................... Breezes New Vegas Males: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/35451 ................................................................... NivSpiceofLife Breeze Patch: This is a optional patch to make the armors fit Breeze\'s male body, it may not be as up to date as the main file but will still work. ....................................................................... Diversified Mojave Wasteland: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/42007 ....................................................................... 1nivDWSLPatch.esp: This is a patch for the mod Diversified Mojave Wasteland, it provides much more diversity of items. ......................................................... Project Nevada: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/40040 ......................................................... 1nivPNSLPatch.esp: This is a patch for the mod Project Nevada, it provides image overlays for headgear. To keep the night vision items added to be balanced, you only find broken versions off enemies. To make working versions go to the workbench, you need to repair them: 1 Broken item 2 Spare Parts 1 Fission Battery 3 Scrap Electronics 2 Sensor Module ===================== FAQ / Troubleshooting ===================== Q: Why are all the items invisible/or a red !? A: You did not install the mod correctly, please take a moment to read through the installation section. Q: My game crashes on start up. A: You have installed a mod that does not have the required master installed. Please take some time and read through the plugin section. Q: Where do you get the items in game? A: You can find all items (but one) in game on random NPCs and through Vendors, the Zombieland outfit is only found in Chet\'s store and rarely on other vendors. A: If you use Player only version you can find all the items in some chests in Goodsprings. See picture for location. Q: How long does it take for the items to show up in game? A: About 4 days waiting will reset all NPC spawns that have already spawned, if you enter a new area that you have not been in before it should work right away. Q. Will this work with Vanilla bodies? A. No it will not work right, you will get splotches and skin issues if you use vanilla bodies with this mod. Q. What about type 6? A. Yes it will work with type 6 because they use the same textures as Type3. Q. Does this work with the pipboy? A. Yes, the new update makes it pipboy compatible. Q. Why do some of the Project Nevada items take up the headband slot when they do not need to? A. That is a requirement for some of the effects to work. Q. Will this work with mods like Fook and Project Nevada? A. It should work with mods that edit the level lists just put the mod you want to work last (or use a bashed/merged patch). Make sure you grab the PN patch. Q: Is this mod compatible with? A. If the mod adds items to the same level lists then it will conflict, nothing game breaking will happen simply which ever mod is lower in the load order will show up on that NPC. Try making a bashed or merged patch for best compatibility. Q. Why do the gloves clip or have a gap? A. That is just how the gloves where made, its a vanilla issue. Q. Where can I find the Zombieland outfit or its not showing up at the store. A. It is the only thing in this mod you can NOT find in the world level lists, you can buy it in Chet\'s store and possibly other stores as well if your lucky. Q. Do the boobs bounce? A. No. Q. I saw some face masks in your WIP pics why are they not in game? A. Permission was currently denied. Q. I think a item is unbalanced. A. Please either post or pm me. Q. Will you make this for FO3? A. That is hard to say right now, this mod uses a ton of NV assets I would have to remove them and edit everything... we will see. ============ Installation ============ PLEASE MAKE SURE YOU READ THE PLUGINS SECTION. There are two ways to install: - Use NMM to install the mod for you. - Download and install the mod manually. --------------------- Archive invalidation --------------------- 1. Make sure you turn on Archive invalidation. ------------------- Nexus Mod Manager: ------------------- 1. Click the \'Download with manager\' button on top of the file. 2. Spice of Life can be activated in NMM\'s mod list when the mod downloaded fully. Double-click on the mod to start the installation. 3. Install the mod. 4. Download and install any optional patches. 5. Finished. ------------------- Manual Installation: ------------------- 1. Use 7zip to extract the files. Extract Spice of Life to a random folder, NOT your Data folder. 2. Manually go through and select your .esps and any patches you would like to install, make sure you have read the Plugins section of this readme. 3. Place selected .esp and .BSA into your Data folder found in Program Files/Steam/steamapps/common/Fallout New Vegas/Data/ 4. Turn on the .esp in your choice of mod manager, or the Fallout New Vegas game data files menu. 5. Download and install any optional patches. 6. Finished. ============== Uninstallation ============== ------------------- Nexus Mod Manager: ------------------- 1. Highlight Spice of Life mod. 2. Select deactivate selected mod. 3. Finished. ------------------- Manual Installation: ------------------- 1. Delete: 1nivVSLArmors.esp 1nivDWSLPatch.esp 1nivPNSLPatch.esp 1nivVSLArmors Cheat.esp 1nivVSLArmors.bsa 2. Finished. ============ Known Issues ============ You WILL have issues with skin textures if you do not use Robert Male Body (or Breeze male body) or a Type 3 Female Body, there is currently no Vanilla bodies version. If you would like to make a fully function Vanilla version of this mod, please PM me. ========== Updates ========== 1.1: - Added missing effect textures - Fixed paths of some effects - Rayban meshes edited to help clipping - Cheater patch added - Fixed vanilla ground meshes from showing if female - Removed modulates voice from Shemagh ---------------------------- 1.0: - Meshes optimized - Textures optimized - New leather backpack texture - Environment masks added to some items - Rebalanced items - All new ground meshes for all items - New icons - Wound decal compatibility - Pipboy compatibility - Skin fixes - Removed Pickelhaube helmets - Removed Wasteland Survivor - Removed Vault Scientist\'s Glove - Name changes - New level lists - Removed Diversified Mojave Wasteland requirement - Added Diversified Mojave Wasteland patch - Added Project Nevada patch - New Readme format ---------------------------- 0.7: - Open Beta Release ---------------------------- 0.6: - Closed Beta ---------------------------- 0.5: - Closed Beta ---------------------------- ===================== CREDITS & PERMISSIONS ===================== Nivea (me): For taking the time to put together the resources of other modders, for making male or female versions of most the resources that had none and for making the new armors/clothing found in the Jeans Folder. Also for making new textures or normal maps for other armors in the mod as well as reducing the poly count, and making all new ground meshes for all armors. Please check the enclosed Spice of Life Variety Credits.txt for the long list of authors. =============== Licensing/Legal =============== Patches are fine so long as no meshes or textures are included in your mod. This mod is NOT to be used without my permission, this includes but not limited to: Uploading to a different site then Nexus Recolors Body Conversions Please drop me a PM if you want to make any of the changes above. ========== Contact ========== You can find me on many different forums, all under the same name Nivea I check all my mail often. Your best bet is Nexus though. Official oblivion forum: http://forums.bethsoft.com/user/66980-nivea/ Nexus: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/users/55918 ========== sincerely, Nivea

SLAVE IN POSE [NV Edition] -------------------------- Do you want to see some hated characters completely helpless?. Now you can. This is my first work in the world of animation and Blender,and I want to share with all of you. How to use -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Type \"TFIK\" (WITHOUT QUOTES) TO SHOW OBJECT POSES CORRECTLY!!! 1. Open console and type: \"tfc\" (without quotes) Close the console again, and move the camera around. 2. In tfc mode, open the console again and click on your character or any npc. A reference name and number, must appears in the top of the screen. 3. Type: playidle \"t00\" to \"t83\" (without quotes) 4. To reset a pose type: playidle \"reset\" (Without quotes) -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- If you want to make a clean screenshot. Open console and type: \"tm\" (Without quotes) I hope that you enjoy with this poses. --------------------------------------------------------- The thanks moment: A lot of thanks to Backsteppo for his fantastic tutorial. Thanks to Blender foundation Thanks to Niftools Thanks to bethesda for bring to us. The Geck and Fallout3 And thanks to you for downloading.

http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=47713 [version 0.9.5d 13.09.2012] [b][color=green][size=4]Currently: Episode II - version 0.9.5d[/size][/color][/b] [size=3]This mod completely supersedes [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/46284]Episode I[/url], and is a complete standalone version.[/size] [b][color=red][size=5]Make a CLEAN save before installing this mod[/size][/color][/b] [b][color=orange][size=4]Introduction[/size][/color][/b] The wasteland has a new band of slavers. These aren\'t just your normal band of raiders with sharp sticks. They are organised and have numerous prison facilities in underground locations; allowing them to operate in secrecy under the noses of the wasteland population. The wasteland slavers only seem to be the tip of the iceberg. Kidnapped citizens are disappearing entirely. Never to be seen again. Rumour has it that kidnapped citizens are being transported to an unknown location outside the wasteland, to an unknown fate. This mod lets you live your life as a slave: captured and spiritied away in the night, you are thrown into a world beyond your control. This mod adds a band of slavers to the Mojave wasteland. Adds prison facilities to the wastes and adds a whole new town in a remote location away from the Mojave. [b][color=yellow][size=3]Note: This mod gives you a radically different gameplay experience. If you want to be an all conquering, elite special forces ninja then this mod isn\'t for you.[/size][/color][/b] [b][color=yellow][size=4]Important note:[/size][/color][/b] Users of SlaveJail Reloaded & SlaveTown - Its a slaves life (Episode I) - Please uninstall these mods since they will conflict. [b][color=yellow][size=4]For general stability and conflict issues:[/size][/color][/b] For general stability and conflict issues, please consider using [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/34703]FNVEdit[/url] to create a merged patch and/or perform a masterupdate. Please see [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/43195]Gophers excellent video[/url] for more details. For general troubleshooting please watch [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/articles/917]Gopher\'s Troubleshooting Video[/url]. (The full series of Gopher\'s videos is well worth watching, and I thoroughly recommend them, they start [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/42832]here[/url].) 64bit operating system users may also wish to consider [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/35262]4GB Fallout New Vegas[/url] or its [url=http://nvse.silverlock.org/beta/fnv4gb_nvse.zip]NVSE enabled version[/url]. You may also wish to use [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/41381]Fake Fullscreen[/url] for further stability. [b][color=yellow][size=4]Starting the Quest:[/size][/color][/b] The quest can be started by reading the note on the bar in the Goodsprings Saloon. You must have left the Goodsprings area and finalised your character first. Also dismiss all of your companions before you start. [b][color=yellow][size=4]Installation:[/size][/color][/b] Copy all the files from the archive to the Fallout New Vegas/Data directory of your installation. Make sure both of the following are active: SlaveTown - Episode II.esm SlaveTown - Episode II - Assets.esp SlaveTown - Episode II - Patch.esp <- ONLY when one is available for the current version For best results, use FOMM or Nexus Mod Manager. Can sell the party pooper properly now Increased stability during races. Can prematurely talk to Sabiel without issue. Sabiel\'s body dump more robust. Cleaned up leftover quest prompts. Hopefully cured some Maggy wierdness. Local Slavers won\'t hang out like Jet whores anymore. Theres no escape for Nose or Frank anymore. The party pooper should be braver now and not run away. http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=39454 [img]http://img824.imageshack.us/img824/8424/mainlogoh.jpg[/img] Version 2.0 BETA (Refer to older version readme.txt or old description at the end for additional information) Before reading the description below, please take into account this version had been for some time a team effort to provide you with Quests. Evertaile was scripting and evolving quests and extra material for Rust Town in order for us to supply you a complete mod filled with everything. Right now and for some time I have lost communication with Evertaile, for reasons still unknown. For over 6 months developing was into stalemate. Taken that into account, a small part of some of the quests are unfinished. I lack the ability to script, so not only I could not effectively beta test current working quest scripts, but also have not been able to alter them in any way whatsoever in fear I brake something beyond repair. So, please feel free to provide feedback and bug reports, so I can write them down for future repair when I will be able to get some help. For downloaders familiar with the old version 1.2: Rust Town has been expanded and is now more than doubled in size and number of interiors as I have also created a second district similar to the original but with a different theme. Quests are mostly taking place in vanilla Rust Town in which more interiors have been integrated and there shall be no inaccessible doors left out of use (main Rust Town). For a complete list of the interiors and places to visit please refer to the list below in section 1.X Rust Town Version 2.0 1.0 Overall Features 2.0 Quests (spoiler free) 3.0 Merchants 4.0 Population 5.0 Dev Team 6.0 Installation 7.0 Bugs and feedback 8.0 Old Versions notes [img]http://img263.imageshack.us/img263/3025/rusttownmap2.jpg[/img] 1.0 Rust Town: 1.1. Main Rust Town District This is the downtown part of the Rust Town. It is updated and now features better A.I. behavior and, as requested by the community, Quests. This is the main area originally created in Version 1 of this mod but not left unchanged, so in this update it all-around features: Interiors: Five residences as in version 1 but now respected residents feature Quests Hubology Temple newly added environment and features Quests and some surprises. Also you may train stats and become part of the hubology cult. Restaurant (as in version 1.2) Rebel Bar (as in version 1.2) Wildlife Exhibition Gallery (updated, expanded and now features Quests) Elementary School (newly added) Community Hall (as in version 1 but now features Quests) Rust Town Sewers (newly added, Quests related environment with hostile creatures) Town s Archive (newly added) Sheriff s Office (as in version 1.2 but now related to Quests) Barracks and Armory (as in version 1.2) Power Station (as in version 1.2) Player s house (as in version 1.2) Exteriors: Clinic Merchant Shops Boat House Train Station Trailer Residences Catwalks e.t.c. 1.2. Slums District: Slums District is the run down, junkie, gun-totting part of Rust Town, it is a whole new massive area with a different theme featuring Quests, population and hostile NPCs depending on the choises of the player. Currently in beta as described in prologue. Interiors: Commoner Houses Slum Gang Base Guard Tent Platinum (an adult Strip Club, Quest Related) Liquor Store Lukes Fine Attire Shady Business Drug Lab (in a mysterious underground environment) Secret Storage Room Exteriors: Created with love, and a certain vision of Den (fallout 2) in conjunction to Mad Max films. Crazy Ol Bill s makeshift fortress Guard Tower Back Alleys Smitty s Car e.t.c. [img]http://img696.imageshack.us/img696/4884/questst.jpg[/img] 2.0 Quests There is a massive number of Quests featured in this mod by now. The community asked for quests, so we delivered. For the number of quests I cannot clarify nor provide you with much help for debugging -see prologue-. Also, there are many quests mostly related with the Slums district that are currently left on paper. Quests will be initiated either by finding and commencing dialogue with certain NPCs, asking around, and there is also a number of quests in the form of bulletin board notes located into the community hall for easy finding. [img]http://img801.imageshack.us/img801/9601/merchants.jpg[/img] 3.0 Merchants 3.1. Lena, trades alcohol and soft drinks 3.2. Restaurant cashier, trades food 3.3. Tom the handyman, trades crafting materials and repairs equipment 3.4. Eustathius, trades creature products and crafting materials 3.5. Rust Town addict, trades medical equipment and drugs 3.6. Vlad, trades alcohol 3.7. Luke, trades clothes and hats 3.8. Gun merchant, trades weapons and armor [img]http://img534.imageshack.us/img534/2213/population.jpg[/img] 4.0 Population Older versions of Rust Town consisted of 28-32 npc population. At this update, the number have reached above 80. 5.0 Dev Team Obliviongr,Evertaile & Lingwei If you have any questions related to this mod you can contact me and I will try to assist. If you are having issues related to quests, contact Evertaile though I cannot promise a response at this point. Also, as I have said before, my ability with scripting is zero. [img]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/5240/installissuescopy.jpg[/img] 6.0 Installation Delete old version file which came as an .esp. Insert into data folder the new .esm master file along with the extra .esp. When more development is complete, everything will be contained in a master file and from then on .esp as patches. 7.0 Bugs and Feedback 7.1. Everataile has managed to fine tune the mod to run more decently at lower end machines. Most bugs, where could be found, in old version were fixed. Issues we had trouble replicating are still a mystery. Also, Evertaile have contacted other mod authors to fix some compatibility issues our mod was having. Most of which are now resolved except one. Rust Town still has issues when running the same time with the mod: “Vault32fix”. Also take into account current state beta testing is somewhat lacking due to loss contact with Evertaile. –said that again didnt I? 7.2. Seems like since Quests came into play, for unknown reasons, some weird AI behavior have been observed. Minor things though, like some residents will occasionally sleep in random places instead of their owned houses. 7.3. Doctor Tara is still broken and will not heal you whatsoever, so do not waste your buck. 7.4. I have witnessed certain door teleporters vanish out of a sudden but all should be working by now. All of the doors should take you somewhere as I have made use of all of them. 7.5. There has been effort to correct any grammatical and spelling mistakes in dialogues to some extend, but since English is not my first language the occasional weirdness will probably strike you. 7.6. Some characters will not initiate dialogue with player and may cause weird behavior. 7.7 Strip Club is lacking background music files, will be updated. 7.8 Normally, since i stopped working on the mod since March, there is bound to be some incompatibilities I am not aware of. 7.9 First of the bat, incompatible with a mod called Warzones. (noted) I will keep the above list updated and add bugs you report. ------------------- ------------------- ------------------- Past / Old Description (January 2011) ------------------- Rust Town. It is a lore friendly town complete with everything one will ever need. It is packed with amenities and numerous places of interest to explore and immerse yourself. My goal while working on this project was to provide a realistic town, full with detail and a unique fallout feel. --------------------- Version 1.10 As of version 1.1, I fixed some bugs and minor issues and added some extra vendors and a thing or two. I would also like to thank the community for its support and the people that pointed out bugs and suggested some extra stuff and features. Fixes: 1. Fixed Paula s dialogue and behavior 2. Fixed a particular door that used to lead into nowhere 3. Some weird behavior some items had in the players house. 4. Replaced the sink in players house and is now useable and the toilet is as well rad-free. Added content: 1. Tom, the town engineer, now sells spare crafting materials. 2. Eustathius the entomologist now sells some particular items like poison glands e.t.c. 3. Added a chemistry set in the clinic, for people with mods that make it useable. 4. Added dialogue to 5 more npcs. 5. An addict in town now sells spare medical equipment. Cut non visible-references: As people suggested I have cut down some references that were not visible but where left for future implementation and were behind some inaccessible doors. As the mod is heavy as it is, all added content from now on will be located in extra interior cells. NOTES: [UPDATE 18.01.2011] 1. As of 16th of January I have teamed up with Evertaile in order to implement quests and provide you people with better content, quests, material and of course more places to explore. [img][/img] Conflicts: Current version is apparently sometimes conflicting with: the mod \"armoror\" and \"vault32fix\" Respected authors have been contacted and next update will be issue-free. Installation: Unpack archive, copy the extracted RustTownV1-1.esp file into your Fallout New Vegas DATA folder and enable the .esp using the vanilla launcher or FOMM. If you have previously downloaded Version 1.00 delete old file first. Uninstall: Just delete RustTownV1-1.esp from your data folder --------------------- HOW TO REACH THE TOWN The town is currently located to the far South West of the map west of Mojave Outpost. You can not reach it by foot at first because of the blocked road, but only by train. Travel to the Vanilla EMERGENCY RAILWAY STATION, located in your pipboy. It is just southeast of POWDER GANGER CAMP SOUTH, and follow the railway tracks. A train will be waiting for you in the station to take you to Rust Town. After one trip, you can use fast travel to travel fourth and back, or keep using the railway stations. Walk to the second wagon behind the engine train and interact with it to travel. (I have included an extra, ready to use explored, map-marker near the station for those who might be having problem locating the vanilla one.) THE TOWN Current population: 28 So far, current .esp consists of: 1. Rust Town Outdoor Environment. Full of detail, themed lighting, dark mood, and lots of beautifully created unique environments and sections all packed in a single monstrous cell, fully navmeshed. 2. Dynamic NPC Population. A wide variety of NPCs, like Sheriff, Deputies, Merchants, Barkeepers, Guards, Residents, Engineers, Doctors, Bums, dogs e.t.c., most of which keep an everyday schedule and some of them have extensive dialogue. 3. Services. Certain NPCs will offer services (Buying/Selling, Repairing, Healing e.t.c.) 4. A Restaurant, to sit and grab a bite. Pick your table. 5. A Bar, to sit and enjoy your cocktails while admiring the view. 6. A Clinic, to stop by and heal your addictions, cleanse your radiation or patch up your crippled limps. 7. A Wildlife Exhibition Gallery, to check out captured wildlife, like cazzadors, geckos, mongrels, ants, rats etc. 8. Players House of course, for you to store your fancy equipment and get some rest. 9. Sheriffs Office with Jail. Behave and leave the prisoner alone. 10. Community Hall. This is where the townspeople meet and discuss their issues. 11. Barracks and Armory. All the guards and deputies need some rest too, right? Now with an implemented armory but not easy to reach. 12. Power Station. The town requires a steady supply of electricity. An engineer attends to this place everyday. 13. Five (5) unique Resident Houses (for the lucky ones that managed to secure a place with a roof, the rest have other means of housing) 14. Livestock Pen. Provides a steady supply of milk and meat. Also, as a necessary part of the mod, i included: 15. Train Station with guess what… a train fully operational so one can travel back and forth to the city if you don’t want to make use of fast travel. (Currently the train station is located in the Mojave Region, at the vanilla EMERGENCY RAILWAY STATION outer cell, which I had to modify a little and bring it back to life in order to accommodate the train wagons). Also you’ll have to use it at least once to unlock Rust Town’s map marker. 16. Rust Towns Train Station and outer Gate, trains need to travel from station to station right? Issues: While travelling with the train to Rust Town, and upon arrival, your companions will spawn at some distance outside the Town Train Station for some reason. SOLUTION: Just fast travel to your current location (RustTown mapmarker) and they will spawn right next to you. Same if you travel back to Mojave. I will need to look more into this. On a side note: 1. As the city is heavily populated and full of detail I experienced some small frame drop issues while beta testing in certain parts of it. Though take note, my computer is two years old. I expect some feedback on this frame drop by you guys. Maybe I will add a lighter version too if enough downloaders request it. 2. Because of the Cazadors behavior and flying animation they sometimes seem to momentarily noclip through their holding tank. But it’s just visual, they can’t get out. 3. The doctor goes to her resident every night to rest. Check back in the morning if you need her services. 4. Tom the handyman, does weapon and armor repairs, if you need his services he will either be wandering, sleeping or, during morning hours, working in the power station. 5. The merchants, barkeepers and restaurant cashiers work 24/7. 6. There are no quests involved as i am not familiar with scripting. Maybe if i get some help something can be worked out. 7. A workbench and a reloading bench can be found inside the Power station. 8. Some doors in the town are inaccessible as I have future plans implementing more stuff. 9. Town lighting is part of the mood I wanted to create. Though screenshots may seem darker than the actual environment, if enough people request a brighter environment I may upload an extra .esp file. 10. The lawmen in the town are a little toughened up in comparison to usual vanilla npcs, so take notice. 11. I excluded npcs carrying energy weapons and spiced em up with wild west weaponry as part of the town’s concept. 12. I had to place a few collision markers in some tight spaces that would get player character stuck behind houses and walls at the outer perimeter of the town. I would have closed all gaps with visual references but, by the end, the mod had already become a little heavy for my cpu and maybe for others. 13. Zero use of scripting. Use of G.E.C.K. provided tools only. I wish I did use scripts for the mod to be more interactive and dynamic but I’m not familiar with scripting. Things to come: 1. More dynamic NPC behavior, more dialogue. Also, maybe voice overs (if I have the time and courage. The voice actors are no issue as I have already gathered enough candidates). 2. Right now I am planning on paper for an adults only kind of themed interior cell and the Town Library, maybe later a place of worship and an underground cemetery. 3. Possibility of extending current town infrastructure to the third level up. Of course if, as is, the town is giving people bad frames per second I will scrap that idea. 4. Extending the Wildlife Exhibition Gallery to contain more animals and insects, add more rooms and sections. Personal notes: The heaviest work: Town inner outdoor Environment (not taking into consideration the inner cells) ~ 8 straight hours working on paper, ~118 straight hours to complete in G.E.C.K. Not a stone unturned. The best way to create new environments is: (A) Plan ahead, draw your ideas on the paper considering what assets the game can provide. (B) Knowing exactly the vanilla assets. Knowing where to find what you need and the variations of it. (C) Master the controls of G.E.C.K. (D) Do not let yourself down. Working with G.E.C.K. is surely creative and gravely time consuming. If you love what you’re doing, believe in it, and want your imagination to come to life through a game mod, you occasionally find yourself working around the clock creating unique environments, doing night swifts. I hope at least some of you guys provide feedback, suggest ideas, point me my mistakes and tell me how to make my mod any better. Take into account this is my 1st mod I ever uploaded, though I fiddled with G.E.C.K. back in Fallout 3. Contact me if you need anything or have any questions. English is not my first language, I am sorry for any grammatical and spelling mistakes. Thanks in advance.

DESCRIPTION =============== The Dragonskin Tactical Outfit mod actually adds a selection of the titular outfits - in different colours and camo patterns - to the Wasteland. It is loosely based on the real Dragon Skin body armour apparently in use today by SWAT teams, Secret Service and other elite military personnel. During testing this armour withstood multiple assault rifle bullet impacts and even point-blank hand grenade blasts. The mod also adds matching \'Dragon\' Combat Helmets, plus Combat Backpacks (that increase the maximum weight the wearer can carry), M40 Gas Masks (that provide some radiation resistance to the wearer), Tactical Goggles and Balaclavas to complete the look. The player will not need to find (or purchase) more than one outfit to be able to use it in different camo configurations: much cheaper and lighter \'camo covers\' for the armour and helmets allow the player to swap the camo type used by the outfit whenever they wish. The outfits themselves are quite expensive, but offer fantastic protection: they are intended to be amongst the best armour available in-game; before stepping up to power armour, that is. For the sake of comparison (with default game values), the outfits offer slightly more protection than Reinforced Combat Armour, but not as much protection as Reinforced Combat Armour Mark 2. The outfits also increase the maximum weight the wearer can carry, and offer mild bonuses to the Small Guns and Sneak skills.
