http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=49857 Please note that this took me about 20 hours in total to plan and make, so any endorsements would be appreciated. I did this because I very much enjoy crafting in video games, and I felt that there was no mod or combination of mods that remedies the lack of good crafting (in my opinion) in Fallout: New Vegas. If you have any questions, complaints or advice then please, by all means, post them in the ‘comments’ tab. Table of Contents I- Description II- Installation Guide III- History IV- FAQs V- List of Added Recipes I- Description This mod adds a very large amount of useful, new crafting recipes to the game including weapons, ammunition, explosives, miscellaneous items, etc. Many craftable items require reusable schematics to craft, and you will find these placed realistically in locations across the Mojave Wasteland. II- Installation Guide REQUIREMENTS: FNV, of course, and all four main DLC packs. (not GRA or those preorder content things) INCOMPATIBILITIES: None, it’s just a crafting mod. With Nexus Mod Manager: Go to the files tab and click ‘Download with Manager’ then doubleclick the downloaded mod. Make sure FNVCI.esp is checked off in the NMM, and put it wherever you want in the load order. With Fallout Mod Manager: Go to the files tab and click ‘download manually’. Download to whatever location you like. Then, in FOMM in your package manager, click ‘Add FOMOD’ and select the downloaded file. Make sure FNVCI.esp is checked off in the FOMM, and put it wherever you want in the load order. With Neither: Go to the files tab and click ‘download manually’. Download to whatever location you like. Then, unpack the downloaded file using either the WinRar or 7Zip application. Drag the .esp to your Fallout: New Vegas data folder, wherever that may be. Then, launch the Fallout: New Vegas .exe but do not click ‘play’. Instead, click ‘data files’ and check off the .esp that you downloaded and put in the ‘data’ folder. III- History April 3, 2013: Initial release. April 29, 2013: 1.1 released, see \'files\' section for what changed. IV- FAQs Q: In the ‘list of new recipes’, why don’t you include the skill requirements and crafting station for each crafting recipe? A: Mainly just because I’m lazy sometimes. I forgot to include the skill requirements and crafting stations, and now I don’t feel like putting them in. Rest assured that there are skill requirements and crafting stations, and they are accurate and neither over- nor underpowered in my opinion. Q: Are you the guy that makes all those Pipboy mods? A: No, that\\\'s ShilohDS, I\\\'m just plain Shiloh. Q: How do I find out what the skill requirements are? A: Either launch the game and find the recipe by activating the recipe’s crafting station, or do as follows: 1. Open the GECK (if you do not have it, get it). 2. Click File-->Data. 3. Make sure FNV.esm and FNVCI.esp are check off, then click ‘OK’. 4. In the Object Window of the GECK, click ‘Miscellaneous’, then ‘Recipe’. 5. All recipes should now show up in the Object Window. Recipes added by me should have the prefix ‘C01C’ in their editor ID. 6. Doubleclick on the editor ID of whatever recipe you want to find the requirements of. 7. In the new window that pops up, you should see the crafting station and skill requirements of that crafting recipe. Q: Why do some gun recipes require the ‘survival’ skill rather than the ‘repair’ or ‘science’ skill? A: The weapons that require you to be high enough in the ‘survival’ skill are generally weapons that I thought of as wild-west weapons (meaning the type of weapon I could visualize a cowboy using), and aren’t very complicated. Since, for whatever reason, I associated the wild west with survival, I gave cowboy-type weapons a ‘survival’ skill requirement. I also wanted to balance all the skills used for crafting, and I felt the ‘survival’ skill was underpowered. Q: Why do so many recipes require flamer fuel? A: For the sake of realism, I wanted something to heat metal and other materials so that they would be malleable. Q: What are the ‘Joshua Graham’s Headwrap’ and ‘Ulysses’ Head and Mask’ recipes? A: In case you didn’t already know, the DLC characters Joshua Graham and Ulysses don’t have normal faces like normal human NPCs. Instead, their faces are actually high-definition non-playable ‘headwear’ apparel made as an experiment, which is why they never have facial animations. I thought it would be cool to be able to wear them, so I made playable copies of them and crafting recipes for them. Keep in mind that I haven’t tested them out, so weird stuff may happen with them. Q: Why are there so many recipes for DLC weapons and apparel? A: I figured some people don’t like doing certain DLCs but have them anyway and like the equipment that comes with it, so I made a reasonable way to get the equipment without actually doing the DLC. Q: What does ‘required’ mean in your crafting recipe list below? A: If an object is ‘required’ in one of my crafting recipes, it means that you need the item to complete the recipe, but you get it back after crafting. Q: Some recipes require schematics, where do I find them? A: They are found strewn throughout the wasteland in realistic places, never sold by vendors or in containers. There is only one of each schematic for every recipe, so be sure not to lose them. Unfortunately, I did not and will not release a cheat sheet detailing where each schematic is, if you really want to find out, do the following: 1. Open the GECK (if you do not have it, get it). 2. Click File-->Data. 3. Make sure FNV.esm and FNVCI.esp are check off, then click ‘OK’. 4. In the Object Window of the GECK, click ‘Items’then ‘Misc Items’. 5. All miscellaneous items should now show up in the object window. Miscellaneous items added by me, including schematics, should have the prefix ‘C01’ in their editor ID. 6. Rightclick on the editor ID of whatever schematic you want to find the location of, then click ‘Use Info’. 7. In the new window that pops up, doubleclick what shows up under ‘Used in these Cells’. 8. In the Render Window of the GECK, you should now be able to see the location of the schematic and the cell that the schematic is in in the Cell View Window. Q: Will you be releasing any updates, additions or patches for this mod? A: Depending on how many downloads and endorsements this mod, I may add new recipes into this mod. I have a few ideas for things I could add. Q: This mod requires all four main DLCs and I don’t have them, is there any solution to this? A: There is if you know your way around the GECK and FNVedit. Otherwise, sorry. I made the mod with all four DLCs because I figured most people already have them. If you don’t have them and are into FNV, I strongly recommend buying each and every one of them. Q: Will you be making other mods? A: This is my first mod ever, and I enjoyed making it, so I plan on making other, albeit different, mods. Q: Do you recommend this mod with other mods? A: I recommend this mod with other crafting mods, mainly just because I like crafting. Q: Why did you make this mod? A: I wanted to get into modding, felt Nexus lacked full crafting mods, and a crafting mod seemed an easy way to start. long_desc.thetext: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=44319 This file is now included in New Vegas Error corrections and bug fixes: http://www.newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=44204. But will continue to be offered seperately as well as within the aforementioned pack. 1.0 Should be complete now. All headgear glasses and masks should work according to what I felt was a logical approach based on model. Note the Space helmet is accounted as a nose object as I could not find a suitable slot for it. Also note this does not fix clipping issues as previously discussed, as frankly I do not have mesh skills as yet. When my Riverside project is far enough along I will use this mod and an attempt to fix the mesh suggestion as my trial run however. ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- I have been editing the stock, and modded headgear I\'ve used in FO3 and FO:NV so that it is compatible with any number of custom hair style mods you will find on here. Now after a fresh install and hard drive wipe I figured this time when I remake it I will upload it. One for use by others who would like to add a since of style, or decent hat usage to their already stylish characters. Two so I wont have to remake it every damn time I reformat my hard drive. Now this is not just a hat fixer. It will fix all vanilla head gear (hats, headbands, helmets.) To allow not only custom hair styles to show on those with room for it, but to allow use for eye-wear and masks where possible. This one currently only touchs the stock Fallout New Vegas game, it should be loaded after any armor or clothing mods to prevent the retagging of items being over written by another mod. Some items, such as the Recon armor helmet are tagged to allow custom hair for those with a bangs(sp) fetish to enjoy a nicely framed face without loosing the extra protection. If you have any suggestions for retagging of those items I have done or have yet to touch please feel free to leave a polite comment. As this is my first mod upload I hope you all enjoy it, I know I do. Things to come: Completeion of the FNV Hat fix in all forms. Any headgear that covers the eye area will eventually be given four-eyes support. Have not decided if I will add water breathing to all resperator/rebreather type masks and helms as its a bit of a stretch to think every one of them is designed for water use. Its mostly as a way to keep from breaking game play by having to switch out your gear for your swimming set. Random additional comments and information: Also keep in mind that hats are not marked with the headband slot, one to reduce confliction with hair styles, and two, because you can infact wear a bandana under/over a hat without it taking up to much space for the hat to fit in reallity. Enjoy -That @#&-hole Minngarm. -Temporary change log: Added four-eyes support for most eye covering head gear. have not adapted power armor helms as yet. The basics of each DLC are done, still getting down with the coding to add four-eyes support ontop of other \"custom\" enchantments on head gear such as the advanced riot armor helm so bear with me while I work my way through this.

http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=38719 \"A World Of Pain\" by David LeMaistre aka Dj Mystro AWOP REQUIRES THE LATEST FNV PATCH to be installed. Description: Adds 114 intense locations to the wasteland filled with enemies and loot. They vary from small Gas Stations to huge maze-like sewers and derelict factories. Adds several days of new gameplay possibilities. A massive new linked Underground complex awaits filled with quests, NPCs with dialogue, vendors and some of the toughest enemies you will encounter anywhere in the game. Also adds many modified weapons, armors and items to the game with enhanced stats to help and hinder you throughout. Everything has been done using vanilla content at this stage so the filsesize should still be tiny. That said everything is complete and navmeshed and there should be no gaps or unfinished interiors. The final version will not have a name change (I changed my mind about that) so it’s gonna be called a Preview forever. Note about Loot: This mod adds quite a lot of loot (though much less than older versions). If you don\'t like finding lots of useful stuff in most AWOP locations then get the Low Loot patches from the patches site. Also if you are concerned that having about 300 extra NPCs in the wasteland will slow your computer down too much grab the LowNPCs Patch (also on the AWOP Patches Site) which removes all but about 15 AWOP NPCs (from exteriors only and removes no-one important or with dialogue). REQUIREMENTS: None apart from one change to the Fallout_default.ini file in order to display the NPCs faces correctly. Open the file \'Fallout_default.ini\' which should be found in the Steam/SteamApps/Common/FalloutNV folder. Search for the line: bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=0 and change it to bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=1 Without this all NPCs faces appear in default skin colour. Apart from this there are no requirements and the mod should run anyway. Make a backup if you are uncomfortable editing the file. There is another version of the Fallout.ini file in the Saved game folder directory (usually in My Documents/My Games). The first one should overwrite this one but if not changing both should do the trick. THE BUG: There is one remaining bug in AWOP FNV that I discovered a little too late to do anything about. It\'s innocuous on it\'s own but couple it with a mod with the same bug and it\'s a CTD-inducer. It only happens in the North Cistern (around the Strip) so it\'s not a big loss either way. The easiest process for fixing it is to run a \"Identical to Master\" filter in FNVEdit and delete AWOP\'s reference to the Cistern from the cell menu. For the sake of refernece any major recurring slowdown or CTDs induced after installing AWOP are the result of mod conflicts or the saved games (quick & auto saves especially) trying to adjust to all the new data. A: There are now two detailed maps of The Underground thanks to bwilderbeast. You can check them out on the images section. Other than that there\'s just the location guide. Q: Are the NPCs voiced? A: At the moment no NPCs have voice overs. There and over 50 NPCs with dialogue in AWOP and I do not have time to do them all. Check out the help post of info in the \'REQUESTING HELP\' section for more info. Q: MY NPCS ARE EXPLODING (and armor dissapearing along with main weapons), is this a bug? A: No, this is not a bug, this is an intentional part opf the AWOP gameplay to avoid too much unbalancing the game with too much loot. These NPCs are referred to as having Destruct on Death (or DOD) implants. See below for ways to configure these DOD NPCs. Q: Can I turn off/alter The DOD (Destruct On Death) loot scripts? A: [From HarderMan] \"Ya, it is optional, but you need to install MCM to use the menu to make it so. There are four options, iirc, one is to plain turn the feature on/off, the other is to turn off the feature that makes it much more difficult to disarm the affected NPCs by crippling their arms(and getting their sweet, sweet loots before they destruct), the third is to have the destructed items removed at 30% health(to prevent the possibility that a massive damage spike causes them to die before their loot is destructed, resulting in a dropped weapon), and the last is to turn on/off the destruction of all loot on death. Again, you need The Mod Configuration Menu to be able to configure these options, it is available here: http://newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=42507 Enjoy, and feel free to PM me with feedback, I\'ll try to stop around here and see how people respond as well. In case anyone is confused, you do not, repeat DO NOT, need MCM to use the AWOP mod, you only need MCM to adjust the loot destruction features. Default settings have high end weapons destructed on affected npcs, harder disarming of affected npcs, and high end weapon removal at 30%. Oh, and I plan on creating a separate esp patch that will affect much more of the AWOP NPCs with loot destruction, for myself and for anyone else that wants minimal loot. Normally I like massive loot, but I want my next playthrough to be more challenging, item wise.\" Q: NOTHING IS SHOWING UP AT ALL FROM AWOP. A: You need to have Fallout New Vegas updated to the latest version to run AWOP. This is the only reason (other than incorrect installation) for *nothing* to show up. Q: Any advice on LOAD ORDERS? A: I\'ll tell you the basics about load orders though I\'m not a specialist with \'em. I just follow these rules: 1: ESM files go first (they have to anyway). It\'s best to see ESMs and ESP as seperate lists requiring thier own attention. 2: FNV at top always followed by DLCS (so mods that use info from these can read it from them/alter it after the master files have loaded first) 3: Priority ESP files that replace a lot of data (Gameplay Overhauls) add a load of stuff or affect a lot of levelled lists (such as Weapon mods) go last so other mods cannot over-write thier changes. Thats it really. Mods that other mods rely on have to go first and the mods you want to overwrite other things/be dominant go last. I pretty much just use guesswork beyond that. Also merged patches help coz if two mods affects a creatues weapon spawns one will overwrite the other without the merged patch (though often still do with one in my experience). Q: Can you reduce the loot? A1: Already done, checkout the AWOP Patches site. There will be a reduced loot version released upon completion of each current main version. Q: Where are the quests? A: Quests are from the following NPCs: Colonel Hoff, (Power Plant A) Frankie, (Frankie\'s Guns & Ammo) Major Cobb, (UG Market) Riazanov, (UG Apartment Offices) Roach, (Freetech Boradcast Building Upper) Sgt McMillan, (Dead Man\'s Pass) Bulldozer, (Emergency Railyard Station/Collapsed Underpass) Also two open trade quests from: Fabrie (Fabrie\'s Shack/Haedbangerz Turf) Schulze (UG Market) Q: Do the ememies respawn? A: Yes, a lot of them do, just not the boss or named characters. Most enemies in \'The Underground\' complex are set to not respawn so once purged you can re-use the tunnels to travel relatively safely. Q: Does Frankie\'s inventory respawn? A: Yes, it does but half of his initial inventory is containted within the store on shelves and such (including a lot of ammo) and these items can only be purchased once. This applies to all the vendors in the Underground too, Salamone in The Underground Armouy for example has aprrox 75% of his stock in the Armory itself and it will not respawn. Q: Why not give the \'M\' weapons unique names? A: Personally I prefer the simple \'M\' for two reasons: 1: The weapons are easy to find in the inventory which I find very important when carrying 20+ guns. 2: There are a lot of them about (more than one of each) so to give them personal names would not really make sense in that they are modified versions of existing weaponry as opposed to uniques. Q: Why M Weapons at all? Are they there coz the enemies are so tough? A: No, they are not there because the enemies are tougher in AWOP (this never even occured to me during thier creation). Many vanilla Unique weapons are superior to M Weapons but if I had spread those about as interesting rewards many people would have rightfully complained. So to rectify this I created a new tier of weaponry. Firstly beause the challenge AWOP offers requires interesting rewards but also because I felt that many vanilla weapons were underpowered and did not want to alter any vanilla stats (to avoid conflicts). On top of this I feel it is more immersive for many reasons but mainly after 200 years all the weapons would not still be identical and NPCs cannot make used of modded weapons so fights can become unbalanced in favor of the player. Q: I\'m getting crashes on every save or when fast-travelling or on enering locations after a certain point in the game with AWOP installed: A: Don\'t worry too much, this is not an AWOP issue, more of a discepancy between save games issue (as far as I can tell). A lot of people encounter it far a lot of reasons. For example it happened to me with no mods running whilst changing the difficulty settings a couple of times in game. Basically you just need to find a save that still works (i.e load a back save from before the issue started), play though the same affected area again and it should work fine. Q: I have killed Labal, Firetooth and/or Smokey but the quest refuses to update (one often is not marked as dead). That\'s a strange but not uncommon bug. I can only guess that it is caused by a conflict of some kind. There\'s a few ways to try and tackle this problem. Open the console in game and type the following: setstage XX03986b 10 Replace XX with AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. That should move you to the next stage of the quest. Alternatively in the console select the dead Gecko with the mouse and type: resurrect this will bring it back to life so you can kill it again.(use \'kill\' in console to do this quickly) I have been told doing this several times can fix the problem. Also you can try just playing through the areas again from quest start or later. If all these fail you most likely have a conflict (if you cannot use console either then this is almost definately the case). Try deselecting mods till everything works properly again. Q: I killed Bertha but she won\'t show up as dead: A: Same as above with the geckos only in the console type the following to set the correct quest stage: setstage XX03986b 30 XX = AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. Description: Adds 114 intense locations to the wasteland filled with enemies and loot. They vary from small Gas Stations to huge maze-like sewers and derelict factories. Adds several days of new gameplay possibilities. A massive new linked Underground complex awaits filled with quests, NPCs with dialogue, vendors and some of the toughest enemies you will encounter anywhere in the game. Also adds many modified weapons, armors and items to the game with enhanced stats to help and hinder you throughout. Everything has been done using vanilla content at this stage so the filsesize should still be tiny. That said everything is complete and navmeshed and there should be no gaps or unfinished interiors. The final version will not have a name change (I changed my mind about that) so it’s gonna be called a Preview forever. Note about Loot: This mod adds quite a lot of loot (though much less than older versions). If you don\'t like finding lots of useful stuff in most AWOP locations then get the Low Loot patches from the patches site. Also if you are concerned that having about 300 extra NPCs in the wasteland will slow your computer down too much grab the LowNPCs Patch (also on the AWOP Patches Site) which removes all but about 15 AWOP NPCs (from exteriors only and removes no-one important or with dialogue). A WORLD OF PAIN 4 DEAD MONEY: Adds several new locations to the Sierra Madre in Dead Money. The new locations are some of the most detailed and unique that I have attempted so far and loot is very scarce. Ammo drops are mostly in bundles of 2-8 rounds and you\'ll need to use the reloading bench a lot and scavenge from every corner to get through the new encounters. Also added are several new notes, recipes and healing items. [SEE BELOW \"LOCATIONS ADDED\" FOR MORE INFO] INSTALLATION: Drag AWorldOfPain(Preview).esm to the Fallout NV data folder. Select from the data menu on startup or use FOMM in the same manner. Launch game & enjoy. [WARNING 01: NEXUS MOD MANAGER Auto-Install function does not seem to work properly with this mod. Use the manual drag & drop process outlined above]. [WARNING 02: AWOP adds a huge amount of content to the vanilla game. For this reason it is best played from a new game to avoid corrupting saved game data by creating large discrepencies in the back load data]. REQUIREMENTS: None apart from one change to the Fallout_default.ini file in order to display the NPCs faces correctly. Open the file \'Fallout_default.ini\' which should be found in the Steam/SteamApps/Common/FalloutNV folder. Search for the line: bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=0 and change it to bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=1 Without this all NPCs faces appear in default skin colour. Apart from this there are no requirements and the mod should run anyway. Make a backup if you are uncomfortable editing the file. There is another version of the Fallout.ini file in the Saved game folder directory (usually in My Documents/My Games). The first one should overwrite this one but if not changing both should do the trick. THE BUG: There is one remaining bug in AWOP FNV that I discovered a little too late to do anything about. It\'s innocuous on it\'s own but couple it with a mod with the same bug and it\'s a CTD-inducer. It only happens in the North Cistern (around the Strip) so it\'s not a big loss either way. The easiest process for fixing it is to run a \"Identical to Master\" filter in FNVEdit and delete AWOP\'s reference to the Cistern from the cell menu. For the sake of refernece any major recurring slowdown or CTDs induced after installing AWOP are the result of mod conflicts or the saved games (quick & auto saves especially) trying to adjust to all the new data. My mind is now on other things (happier things I feel) and I do not have the time to maintain these mods or the comments pages anymore. Thanks for the feedback over the years and sorry if I have been a needlessly harsh gobshyte in the past. It\'s nothing personal. I don\'t think it will crash any games if you play with both mods running but you will only end up in the overriding mods interior. FAQ: Q: Is there a map? A: There are now two detailed maps of The Underground thanks to bwilderbeast. You can check them out on the images section. Other than that there\'s just the location guide. Q: Are the NPCs voiced? A: At the moment no NPCs have voice overs. There and over 50 NPCs with dialogue in AWOP and I do not have time to do them all. Check out the help post of info in the \'REQUESTING HELP\' section for more info. Q: MY NPCS ARE EXPLODING (and armor dissapearing along with main weapons), is this a bug? A: No, this is not a bug, this is an intentional part opf the AWOP gameplay to avoid too much unbalancing the game with too much loot. These NPCs are referred to as having Destruct on Death (or DOD) implants. See below for ways to configure these DOD NPCs. Q: Can I turn off/alter The DOD (Destruct On Death) loot scripts? A: [From HarderMan] \"Ya, it is optional, but you need to install MCM to use the menu to make it so. There are four options, iirc, one is to plain turn the feature on/off, the other is to turn off the feature that makes it much more difficult to disarm the affected NPCs by crippling their arms(and getting their sweet, sweet loots before they destruct), the third is to have the destructed items removed at 30% health(to prevent the possibility that a massive damage spike causes them to die before their loot is destructed, resulting in a dropped weapon), and the last is to turn on/off the destruction of all loot on death. Again, you need The Mod Configuration Menu to be able to configure these options, it is available here: http://newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=42507 Enjoy, and feel free to PM me with feedback, I\'ll try to stop around here and see how people respond as well. In case anyone is confused, you do not, repeat DO NOT, need MCM to use the AWOP mod, you only need MCM to adjust the loot destruction features. Default settings have high end weapons destructed on affected npcs, harder disarming of affected npcs, and high end weapon removal at 30%. Oh, and I plan on creating a separate esp patch that will affect much more of the AWOP NPCs with loot destruction, for myself and for anyone else that wants minimal loot. Normally I like massive loot, but I want my next playthrough to be more challenging, item wise.\" Q: NOTHING IS SHOWING UP AT ALL FROM AWOP. A: You need to have Fallout New Vegas updated to the latest version to run AWOP. This is the only reason (other than incorrect installation) for *nothing* to show up. Q: Any advice on LOAD ORDERS? A: I\'ll tell you the basics about load orders though I\'m not a specialist with \'em. I just follow these rules: 1: ESM files go first (they have to anyway). It\'s best to see ESMs and ESP as seperate lists requiring thier own attention. 2: FNV at top always followed by DLCS (so mods that use info from these can read it from them/alter it after the master files have loaded first) 3: Priority ESP files that replace a lot of data (Gameplay Overhauls) add a load of stuff or affect a lot of levelled lists (such as Weapon mods) go last so other mods cannot over-write thier changes. Thats it really. Mods that other mods rely on have to go first and the mods you want to overwrite other things/be dominant go last. I pretty much just use guesswork beyond that. Also merged patches help coz if two mods affects a creatues weapon spawns one will overwrite the other without the merged patch (though often still do with one in my experience). Q: Can you reduce the loot? A1: Already done, checkout the AWOP Patches site. There will be a reduced loot version released upon completion of each current main version. Q: Where are the quests? A: Quests are from the following NPCs: Colonel Hoff, (Power Plant A) Frankie, (Frankie\'s Guns & Ammo) Major Cobb, (UG Market) Riazanov, (UG Apartment Offices) Roach, (Freetech Boradcast Building Upper) Sgt McMillan, (Dead Man\'s Pass) Bulldozer, (Emergency Railyard Station/Collapsed Underpass) Also two open trade quests from: Fabrie (Fabrie\'s Shack/Haedbangerz Turf) Schulze (UG Market) Q: Do the ememies respawn? A: Yes, a lot of them do, just not the boss or named characters. Most enemies in \'The Underground\' complex are set to not respawn so once purged you can re-use the tunnels to travel relatively safely. Q: Does Frankie\'s inventory respawn? A: Yes, it does but half of his initial inventory is containted within the store on shelves and such (including a lot of ammo) and these items can only be purchased once. This applies to all the vendors in the Underground too, Salamone in The Underground Armouy for example has aprrox 75% of his stock in the Armory itself and it will not respawn. Q: Why not give the \'M\' weapons unique names? A: Personally I prefer the simple \'M\' for two reasons: 1: The weapons are easy to find in the inventory which I find very important when carrying 20+ guns. 2: There are a lot of them about (more than one of each) so to give them personal names would not really make sense in that they are modified versions of existing weaponry as opposed to uniques. Q: Why M Weapons at all? Are they there coz the enemies are so tough? A: No, they are not there because the enemies are tougher in AWOP (this never even occured to me during thier creation). Many vanilla Unique weapons are superior to M Weapons but if I had spread those about as interesting rewards many people would have rightfully complained. So to rectify this I created a new tier of weaponry. Firstly beause the challenge AWOP offers requires interesting rewards but also because I felt that many vanilla weapons were underpowered and did not want to alter any vanilla stats (to avoid conflicts). On top of this I feel it is more immersive for many reasons but mainly after 200 years all the weapons would not still be identical and NPCs cannot make used of modded weapons so fights can become unbalanced in favor of the player. If you still do not like them as they are they can be removed using one of the Low Loot patches from the patches site or replaced and reskinned by a very cool new firearm set courtesy of Book of Earache and the BOE Patch from the AWOP/BOE Patch site. Q: I have killed Labal, Firetooth and/or Smokey but the quest refuses to update (one often is not marked as dead). That\'s a strange but not uncommon bug. I can only guess that it is caused by a conflict of some kind. There\'s a few ways to try and tackle this problem. Open the console in game and type the following: setstage XX03986b 10 Replace XX with AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. That should move you to the next stage of the quest. Alternatively in the console select the dead Gecko with the mouse and type: resurrect this will bring it back to life so you can kill it again.(use \'kill\' in console to do this quickly) I have been told doing this several times can fix the problem. Also you can try just playing through the areas again from quest start or later. If all these fail you most likely have a conflict (if you cannot use console either then this is almost definately the case). Try deselecting mods till everything works properly again. Q: I killed Bertha but she won\'t show up as dead: A: Same as above with the geckos only in the console type the following to set the correct quest stage: setstage XX03986b 30 XX = AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. 10 = Just an example in this case. A WORLD OF PAIN 4 DEAD MONEY: Adds several new locations to the Sierra Madre in Dead Money. The new locations are some of the most detailed and unique that I have attempted so far and loot is very scarce. Ammo drops are mostly in bundles of 2-8 rounds and you\'ll need to use the reloading bench a lot and scavenge from every corner to get through the new encounters. Also added are several new notes, recipes and healing items. [SEE BELOW \"LOCATIONS ADDED\" FOR MORE INFO] INSTALLATION: Drag AWorldOfPain(Preview).esm to the Fallout NV data folder. Select from the data menu on startup or use FOMM in the same manner. Launch game & enjoy. [WARNING 01: NEXUS MOD MANAGER Auto-Install function does not seem to work properly with this mod. Use the manual drag & drop process outlined above]. [WARNING 02: AWOP adds a huge amount of content to the vanilla game. For this reason it is best played from a new game to avoid corrupting saved game data by creating large discrepencies in the back load data]. REQUIREMENTS: None apart from one change to the Fallout_default.ini file in order to display the NPCs faces correctly. Open the file \'Fallout_default.ini\' which should be found in the Steam/SteamApps/Common/FalloutNV folder. Search for the line: bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=0 and change it to bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=1 Without this all NPCs faces appear in default skin colour. Apart from this there are no requirements and the mod should run anyway. Make a backup if you are uncomfortable editing the file. There is another version of the Fallout.ini file in the Saved game folder directory (usually in My Documents/My Games). The first one should overwrite this one but if not changing both should do the trick. THE BUG: There is one remaining bug in AWOP FNV that I discovered a little too late to do anything about. It\'s innocuous on it\'s own but couple it with a mod with the same bug and it\'s a CTD-inducer. It only happens in the North Cistern (around the Strip) so it\'s not a big loss either way. The easiest process for fixing it is to run a \"Identical to Master\" filter in FNVEdit and delete AWOP\'s reference to the Cistern from the cell menu. For the sake of refernece any major recurring slowdown or CTDs induced after installing AWOP are the result of mod conflicts or the saved games (quick & auto saves especially) trying to adjust to all the new data. My mind is now on other things (happier things I feel) and I do not have the time to maintain these mods or the comments pages anymore. Thanks for the feedback over the years and sorry if I have been a needlessly harsh gobshyte in the past. It\'s nothing personal. A: At the moment no NPCs have voice overs. There and over 50 NPCs with dialogue in AWOP and I do not have time to do them all. Check out the help post of info in the \'REQUESTING HELP\' section for more info. Q: MY NPCS ARE EXPLODING (and armor dissapearing along with main weapons), is this a bug? A: No, this is not a bug, this is an intentional part opf the AWOP gameplay to avoid too much unbalancing the game with too much loot. These NPCs are referred to as having Destruct on Death (or DOD) implants. See below for ways to configure these DOD NPCs. Q: Can I turn off/alter The DOD (Destruct On Death) loot scripts? A: [From HarderMan] \"Ya, it is optional, but you need to install MCM to use the menu to make it so. There are four options, iirc, one is to plain turn the feature on/off, the other is to turn off the feature that makes it much more difficult to disarm the affected NPCs by crippling their arms(and getting their sweet, sweet loots before they destruct), the third is to have the destructed items removed at 30% health(to prevent the possibility that a massive damage spike causes them to die before their loot is destructed, resulting in a dropped weapon), and the last is to turn on/off the destruction of all loot on death. Again, you need The Mod Configuration Menu to be able to configure these options, it is available here: http://newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=42507 Enjoy, and feel free to PM me with feedback, I\'ll try to stop around here and see how people respond as well. In case anyone is confused, you do not, repeat DO NOT, need MCM to use the AWOP mod, you only need MCM to adjust the loot destruction features. Default settings have high end weapons destructed on affected npcs, harder disarming of affected npcs, and high end weapon removal at 30%. Oh, and I plan on creating a separate esp patch that will affect much more of the AWOP NPCs with loot destruction, for myself and for anyone else that wants minimal loot. Normally I like massive loot, but I want my next playthrough to be more challenging, item wise.\" Q: NOTHING IS SHOWING UP AT ALL FROM AWOP. A: You need to have Fallout New Vegas updated to the latest version to run AWOP. This is the only reason (other than incorrect installation) for *nothing* to show up. Q: Any advice on LOAD ORDERS? A: I\'ll tell you the basics about load orders though I\'m not a specialist with \'em. I just follow these rules: 1: ESM files go first (they have to anyway). It\'s best to see ESMs and ESP as seperate lists requiring thier own attention. 2: FNV at top always followed by DLCS (so mods that use info from these can read it from them/alter it after the master files have loaded first) 3: Priority ESP files that replace a lot of data (Gameplay Overhauls) add a load of stuff or affect a lot of levelled lists (such as Weapon mods) go last so other mods cannot over-write thier changes. Thats it really. Mods that other mods rely on have to go first and the mods you want to overwrite other things/be dominant go last. I pretty much just use guesswork beyond that. Also merged patches help coz if two mods affects a creatues weapon spawns one will overwrite the other without the merged patch (though often still do with one in my experience). A: Personally I prefer the simple \'M\' for two reasons: 1: The weapons are easy to find in the inventory which I find very important when carrying 20+ guns. 2: There are a lot of them about (more than one of each) so to give them personal names would not really make sense in that they are modified versions of existing weaponry as opposed to uniques. Q: Why M Weapons at all? Are they there coz the enemies are so tough? A: No, they are not there because the enemies are tougher in AWOP (this never even occured to me during thier creation). Many vanilla Unique weapons are superior to M Weapons but if I had spread those about as interesting rewards many people would have rightfully complained. So to rectify this I created a new tier of weaponry. Firstly beause the challenge AWOP offers requires interesting rewards but also because I felt that many vanilla weapons were underpowered and did not want to alter any vanilla stats (to avoid conflicts). On top of this I feel it is more immersive for many reasons but mainly after 200 years all the weapons would not still be identical and NPCs cannot make used of modded weapons so fights can become unbalanced in favor of the player. If you still do not like them as they are they can be removed using one of the Low Loot patches from the patches site or replaced and reskinned by a very cool new firearm set courtesy of Book of Earache and the BOE Patch from the AWOP/BOE Patch site. Q: I have killed Labal, Firetooth and/or Smokey but the quest refuses to update (one often is not marked as dead). That\'s a strange but not uncommon bug. I can only guess that it is caused by a conflict of some kind. There\'s a few ways to try and tackle this problem. Open the console in game and type the following: setstage XX03986b 10 Replace XX with AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. That should move you to the next stage of the quest. Alternatively in the console select the dead Gecko with the mouse and type: resurrect this will bring it back to life so you can kill it again.(use \'kill\' in console to do this quickly) I have been told doing this several times can fix the problem. Also you can try just playing through the areas again from quest start or later. If all these fail you most likely have a conflict (if you cannot use console either then this is almost definately the case). Try deselecting mods till everything works properly again. Q: I killed Bertha but she won\'t show up as dead: A: Same as above with the geckos only in the console type the following to set the correct quest stage: setstage XX03986b 30 XX = AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. Description: Adds 114 intense locations to the wasteland filled with enemies and loot. They vary from small Gas Stations to huge maze-like sewers and derelict factories. Adds several days of new gameplay possibilities. Everything has been done using vanilla content at this stage so the filsesize should still be tiny. That said everything is complete and navmeshed and there should be no gaps or unfinished interiors. A WORLD OF PAIN 4 DEAD MONEY: Adds several new locations to the Sierra Madre in Dead Money. The new locations are some of the most detailed and unique that I have attempted so far and loot is very scarce. Ammo drops are mostly in bundles of 2-8 rounds and you\'ll need to use the reloading bench a lot and scavenge from every corner to get through the new encounters. Also added are several new notes, recipes and healing items. [SEE BELOW \"LOCATIONS ADDED\" FOR MORE INFO] INSTALLATION: Drag AWorldOfPain(Preview).esm to the Fallout NV data folder. Select from the data menu on startup or use FOMM in the same manner. Launch game & enjoy. [WARNING 01: NEXUS MOD MANAGER Auto-Install function does not seem to work properly with this mod. Use the manual drag & drop process outlined above]. [WARNING 02: AWOP adds a huge amount of content to the vanilla game. For this reason it is best played from a new game to avoid corrupting saved game data by creating large discrepencies in the back load data]. REQUIREMENTS: None apart from one change to the Fallout_default.ini file in order to display the NPCs faces correctly. Open the file \'Fallout_default.ini\' which should be found in the Steam/SteamApps/Common/FalloutNV folder. Search for the line: bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=0 and change it to bLoadFaceGenHeadEGTFiles=1 Without this all NPCs faces appear in default skin colour. Apart from this there are no requirements and the mod should run anyway. Make a backup if you are uncomfortable editing the file. There is another version of the Fallout.ini file in the Saved game folder directory (usually in My Documents/My Games). The first one should overwrite this one but if not changing both should do the trick. THE BUG: There is one remaining bug in AWOP FNV that I discovered a little too late to do anything about. It\'s innocuous on it\'s own but couple it with a mod with the same bug and it\'s a CTD-inducer. It only happens in the North Cistern (around the Strip) so it\'s not a big loss either way. The easiest process for fixing it is to run a \"Identical to Master\" filter in FNVEdit and delete AWOP\'s reference to the Cistern from the cell menu. For the sake of refernece any major recurring slowdown or CTDs induced after installing AWOP are the result of mod conflicts or the saved games (quick & auto saves especially) trying to adjust to all the new data. AWOP IS COMPLETD: Hey everyone, I\'m sorry to say that I\'ll probably never be updating the AWOP mods again. It\'s nothing against the Nexus or the games or modding scene in general. I feel I have done all I can with the Fallout games and have burned out on them to such an extent I can\'t even play through my own stuff anymore. My mind is now on other things (happier things I feel) and I do not have the time to maintain these mods or the comments pages anymore. Thanks for the feedback over the years and sorry if I have been a needlessly harsh gobshyte in the past. It\'s nothing personal. I get frustrated easily for a lot of reasons and tend to fire off in all directions but there\'s not time to go into that here. All the best to everyone that has helped out with AWOP, any of my other mods or just enjoyed the experience and felt inclined to let me know (and the modding scene in general of course) :) I\'ll email Star now and see if she is still interested in making the voice mod. I have about 10-15 voices ready at the moment so it\'s still far from complete but at least if work begins and is released people with have somewehere else to organise their comments for the mod. CONFLICTS: Changes to the exterior wasteland have been kept to an absolute minimum, mostly to avoid conflicts but also to avoid heavily changing the exterior navmesh which can be very awkward at times. As a result conflicts should be minimal. Goodsprings has been changed slightly so anything that alters certain Goodsprings interiors will conflict. The same with certain Stations, shacks etc... I don\'t think it will crash any games if you play with both mods running but you will only end up in the overriding mods interior. FAQ: Q: Is there a map? A: There are now two detailed maps of The Underground thanks to bwilderbeast. You can check them out on the images section. Other than that there\'s just the location guide. Q: Are the NPCs voiced? A: At the moment no NPCs have voice overs. There and over 50 NPCs with dialogue in AWOP and I do not have time to do them all. Check out the help post of info in the \'REQUESTING HELP\' section for more info. Q: MY NPCS ARE EXPLODING (and armor dissapearing along with main weapons), is this a bug? A: No, this is not a bug, this is an intentional part opf the AWOP gameplay to avoid too much unbalancing the game with too much loot. These NPCs are referred to as having Destruct on Death (or DOD) implants. See below for ways to configure these DOD NPCs. Q: Can I turn off/alter The DOD (Destruct On Death) loot scripts? A: [From HarderMan] \"Ya, it is optional, but you need to install MCM to use the menu to make it so. There are four options, iirc, one is to plain turn the feature on/off, the other is to turn off the feature that makes it much more difficult to disarm the affected NPCs by crippling their arms(and getting their sweet, sweet loots before they destruct), the third is to have the destructed items removed at 30% health(to prevent the possibility that a massive damage spike causes them to die before their loot is destructed, resulting in a dropped weapon), and the last is to turn on/off the destruction of all loot on death. Again, you need The Mod Configuration Menu to be able to configure these options, it is available here: http://newvegasnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=42507 Enjoy, and feel free to PM me with feedback, I\'ll try to stop around here and see how people respond as well. In case anyone is confused, you do not, repeat DO NOT, need MCM to use the AWOP mod, you only need MCM to adjust the loot destruction features. Default settings have high end weapons destructed on affected npcs, harder disarming of affected npcs, and high end weapon removal at 30%. Oh, and I plan on creating a separate esp patch that will affect much more of the AWOP NPCs with loot destruction, for myself and for anyone else that wants minimal loot. Normally I like massive loot, but I want my next playthrough to be more challenging, item wise.\" Q: NOTHING IS SHOWING UP AT ALL FROM AWOP. A: You need to have Fallout New Vegas updated to the latest version to run AWOP. This is the only reason (other than incorrect installation) for *nothing* to show up. Q: Any advice on LOAD ORDERS? A: I\'ll tell you the basics about load orders though I\'m not a specialist with \'em. I just follow these rules: 1: ESM files go first (they have to anyway). It\'s best to see ESMs and ESP as seperate lists requiring thier own attention. 2: FNV at top always followed by DLCS (so mods that use info from these can read it from them/alter it after the master files have loaded first) 3: Priority ESP files that replace a lot of data (Gameplay Overhauls) add a load of stuff or affect a lot of levelled lists (such as Weapon mods) go last so other mods cannot over-write thier changes. Thats it really. Mods that other mods rely on have to go first and the mods you want to overwrite other things/be dominant go last. I pretty much just use guesswork beyond that. Also merged patches help coz if two mods affects a creatues weapon spawns one will overwrite the other without the merged patch (though often still do with one in my experience). Q: Can you reduce the loot? A1: Already done, checkout the AWOP Patches site. There will be a reduced loot version released upon completion of each current main version. Q: Where are the quests? A: Quests are from the following NPCs: Colonel Hoff, (Power Plant A) Frankie, (Frankie\'s Guns & Ammo) Major Cobb, (UG Market) Riazanov, (UG Apartment Offices) Roach, (Freetech Boradcast Building Upper) Sgt McMillan, (Dead Man\'s Pass) Bulldozer, (Emergency Railyard Station/Collapsed Underpass) Also two open trade quests from: Fabrie (Fabrie\'s Shack/Haedbangerz Turf) Schulze (UG Market) Q: Do the ememies respawn? A: Yes, a lot of them do, just not the boss or named characters. Most enemies in \'The Underground\' complex are set to not respawn so once purged you can re-use the tunnels to travel relatively safely. Q: Does Frankie\'s inventory respawn? A: Yes, it does but half of his initial inventory is containted within the store on shelves and such (including a lot of ammo) and these items can only be purchased once. This applies to all the vendors in the Underground too, Salamone in The Underground Armouy for example has aprrox 75% of his stock in the Armory itself and it will not respawn. Q: Why not give the \'M\' weapons unique names? A: Personally I prefer the simple \'M\' for two reasons: 1: The weapons are easy to find in the inventory which I find very important when carrying 20+ guns. 2: There are a lot of them about (more than one of each) so to give them personal names would not really make sense in that they are modified versions of existing weaponry as opposed to uniques. Q: Why M Weapons at all? Are they there coz the enemies are so tough? A: No, they are not there because the enemies are tougher in AWOP (this never even occured to me during thier creation). Many vanilla Unique weapons are superior to M Weapons but if I had spread those about as interesting rewards many people would have rightfully complained. So to rectify this I created a new tier of weaponry. Firstly beause the challenge AWOP offers requires interesting rewards but also because I felt that many vanilla weapons were underpowered and did not want to alter any vanilla stats (to avoid conflicts). On top of this I feel it is more immersive for many reasons but mainly after 200 years all the weapons would not still be identical and NPCs cannot make used of modded weapons so fights can become unbalanced in favor of the player. If you still do not like them as they are they can be removed using one of the Low Loot patches from the patches site or replaced and reskinned by a very cool new firearm set courtesy of Book of Earache and the BOE Patch from the AWOP/BOE Patch site. Q: I have killed Labal, Firetooth and/or Smokey but the quest refuses to update (one often is not marked as dead). That\'s a strange but not uncommon bug. I can only guess that it is caused by a conflict of some kind. There\'s a few ways to try and tackle this problem. Open the console in game and type the following: setstage XX03986b 10 Replace XX with AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). Then just take the first two numbers that appear after his/its name. That should move you to the next stage of the quest. Alternatively in the console select the dead Gecko with the mouse and type: resurrect this will bring it back to life so you can kill it again.(use \'kill\' in console to do this quickly) I have been told doing this several times can fix the problem. Also you can try just playing through the areas again from quest start or later. If all these fail you most likely have a conflict (if you cannot use console either then this is almost definately the case). Try deselecting mods till everything works properly again. Q: I killed Bertha but she won\'t show up as dead: A: Same as above with the geckos only in the console type the following to set the correct quest stage: setstage XX03986b 30 XX = AWOP\'s mod index number, you can find this by checking in FOMM or by activating the console and clicking on something from the mod (e.g Frankie). [b][size=6pt]3[/b][/size][size=4pt][center][b][color=#00BFFF]What NVEC Does This mod is a ginormous Compilation of hundreds of different mods All plugins are standalone meaning they don\'t require each other to run unless using patches[/b][/center][/color][/size] [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Complete[/b] contains Reduce CTD + BugFixes + Enhancements all in one esm. Obviously you don\'t need to run the others when selecting this one.[/color] This plugin is mostly a compilation of hundreds of different mods which massively reduces load orders, increases immersion, adds quests, restores uncut content, integrates new weapons/armors into the game properly, turns useless statics into containers/activators, and much more. Not only does it contain all of that, it also has my own tweaks and inclusions which are more map markers to unmarked locations, companions gear are all shown in inventories so you can fully customize your followers however you wish. Most mods merged into here have either been fixed, designed for NVEC users, changed to better suit FNV, and/or expanded to all DLCs. For the full list of inclusions, click links a little lower to make sure you don\'t have a plugin running that\'s already in this esm. I\'ve gone through great detail and time putting this plugin together so I hope you enjoy it :) [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Complete + NVCE[/color][/b] is the same as Complete but with [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=39325]NVCE - New Vegas Character Expansions[/url] integrated by me and NVCE made by [url=http://www.newvegasnexus.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1236116]Machienzo[/url]. The primary focus of NVCE is the alterations of NPCs, which range from cosmetic fixes, stat changes, inventory etc in order to comply with a strict principle of Fallout lore. The best way to think of this is as Fallout 3\'s \"Project Beauty\" or the \"New Vegas Redesigned\". Many of the issues addressed include terribly disproportional faces and wacky hair colouring (see pictures for more detail). Problems with faces clipping through masks or goggles for NPCs have also been addressed (ie. African American\'s protruding lips cause clipping issues with Legion face masks). There are also problems with NPC inventories, and these have been addressed also. Although credit is where credits due; for most of the important named NPCs do happen to look reasonably created and far more distinctive than Fallout 3\'s unique NPCs. However, there are still countless NPCs with unacceptable styles, such as bright hair, pale skin or just being plain ugly. [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC BugFixes[/color][/b] is a separated esm from Complete which just contains fixes to activators, ingestibles, ammunitions, armor, cells, classes, containers, creatures, dialogue topics, doors, object effects, factions, form lists, globals, head parts, lights, leveled items, messages, base effects, misc items, notes, npcs, packages, perks, projectiles, quests, recipes, scripts, sounds, actor effects, statics, terminals, texture sets, weapons, worldspaces, etc. They all are my fixes and many many mod authors work mixed in. Mods included most likely have been fixed in one way or another by me. The whole list of inclusions are at the link a little lower. [b][size=6pt]3[/b][/size][size=4pt][center][b][color=#00BFFF]What NVEC Does This mod is a ginormous Compilation of hundreds of different mods All plugins are standalone meaning they don\'t require each other to run unless using patches[/b][/center][/color][/size] [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Complete[/b] contains Reduce CTD + BugFixes + Enhancements all in one esm. Obviously you don\'t need to run the others when selecting this one.[/color] This plugin is mostly a compilation of hundreds of different mods which massively reduces load orders, increases immersion, adds quests, restores uncut content, integrates new weapons/armors into the game properly, turns useless statics into containers/activators, and much more. Not only does it contain all of that, it also has my own tweaks and inclusions which are more map markers to unmarked locations, companions gear are all shown in inventories so you can fully customize your followers however you wish. Most mods merged into here have either been fixed, designed for NVEC users, changed to better suit FNV, and/or expanded to all DLCs. For the full list of inclusions, click links a little lower to make sure you don\'t have a plugin running that\'s already in this esm. I\'ve gone through great detail and time putting this plugin together so I hope you enjoy it :) [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Complete + NVCE[/color][/b] is the same as Complete but with [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=39325]NVCE - New Vegas Character Expansions[/url] integrated by me and NVCE made by [url=http://www.newvegasnexus.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1236116]Machienzo[/url]. The primary focus of NVCE is the alterations of NPCs, which range from cosmetic fixes, stat changes, inventory etc in order to comply with a strict principle of Fallout lore. The best way to think of this is as Fallout 3\'s \"Project Beauty\" or the \"New Vegas Redesigned\". Many of the issues addressed include terribly disproportional faces and wacky hair colouring (see pictures for more detail). Problems with faces clipping through masks or goggles for NPCs have also been addressed (ie. African American\'s protruding lips cause clipping issues with Legion face masks). There are also problems with NPC inventories, and these have been addressed also. Although credit is where credits due; for most of the important named NPCs do happen to look reasonably created and far more distinctive than Fallout 3\'s unique NPCs. However, there are still countless NPCs with unacceptable styles, such as bright hair, pale skin or just being plain ugly. [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC BugFixes[/color][/b] is a separated esm from Complete which just contains fixes to activators, ingestibles, ammunitions, armor, cells, classes, containers, creatures, dialogue topics, doors, object effects, factions, form lists, globals, head parts, lights, leveled items, messages, base effects, misc items, notes, npcs, packages, perks, projectiles, quests, recipes, scripts, sounds, actor effects, statics, terminals, texture sets, weapons, worldspaces, etc. They all are my fixes and many many mod authors work mixed in. Mods included most likely have been fixed in one way or another by me. The whole list of inclusions are at the link a little lower. [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC BugFixes + NVCE[/color][/b] is the same as NVEC BugFixes but with [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=39325]NVCE - New Vegas Character Expansions[/url] integrated by me and NVCE made by [url=http://www.newvegasnexus.com/modules/members/index.php?id=1236116]Machienzo[/url]. [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Enhancements[/color][/b] is a separated esp from Complete that just contains enhancements and no bugfixes. Contains improvements, changes, expansions, tweaks, reduced annoyances, and basically making FNV badass and how it should have been in the 1st place. It\'s my enhancements and many many mod authors work mixed in. Mods included most likely have been fixed in one way or another by me. The whole list of inclusions are at the link a little lower. [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Reduce CTD[/color][/b] is a separated esp from Complete that repairs [url=http://pastebin.com/X1Eakfup]errors/warnings[/url] in FNV and DLC ESMs reported by [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/34703]FNVEdit[/url]. This results in quests, loading worldspaces/cells, roaming the wastes, and basically running FNV in general with considerably less crashes. This plugin is how this mod all got started and where my skills mostly are. [color=#FFD700][b]NVEC Extras - MCM[/color][/b] is an optional plugin made separately towards the Mod Config Menu. It requires the Mod Config Menu and NVSE. It only contains the [url=http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=39997]FPS Weapon Wheel[/url] at the moment. THIS PLUGIN IS STRICTLY FOR MCM MODS ONLY [color=#FFD700][b]More Perks Merge[/color][/b] is a version of Dree\'s More Perks combining all his esps/esms into one esm. Includes More Perks, More Traits, More Perks for Companions, and all his updates. The fomod installation is designed to output the NO DLC and DLC as the same name. long_desc.thetext: http://newvegas.nexusmods.com/mods/51664//? So, it has come to this.... I've been making bug fixes for Fallout: New Vegas for years. It was inevitable, really. Sooner or later I was bound to have a direct hand in some kind of bug fix compilation for the game, rather than just sitting back and letting someone else do all the hard work of merging and checking compatibility. Others had filled the role in the past - Zenball, Dynastia, Linmor, more I'm sure I'm forgetting - but they've moved on, and now it's my turn. So here it is: my effort in creating a successor to the various Community Bugfix Compilations and Inofficial Patches. I give you (drumroll please): Yukichigai's Unofficial Patch (Or "YUP" for short) I know, terribly inventive name. At least it abbreviates well. What is Yukichigai's Unofficial Patch anyway? YUP (as I'm going to call it) is just what it sounds like: an unofficial patch for Fallout: New Vegas. YUP addresses a number of bugs, exploits, and other such issues with Fallout: New Vegas that were not fixed by the final official patch to the game. There are enough bugs left in the game that having some mod which fixes them is vital, and (in my slightly biased opinion) YUP meets that need admirably. So what does it fix? A lot of bugs in the main game as well as all DLCs (Courier's Stash, Dead Money, Gun Runners' Arsenal, Honest Hearts, Lonesome Road, and Old World Blues). What bugs? Well it's a really, really long list, several pages in fact and too much to put in the main description. You can check the full list of fixes by checking the ReadMe section for this mod. If you don't want to though, here are some examples: - Fixes the Dead Money perk In Shining Armor so that it actually does something - Corrects the female mesh for the Pimp-Boy 3 Billion so that it's not held at an angle - Fixes Boone's head tracking and stops him from holstering his weapon every 5 seconds in combat - Alters Fixer so that it cures addiction temporarily as it says, not permanently - Ultrajet addiction can now be cured by doctors - Stops various dead NPCs and creatures from miraculously resurrecting 3 days later - Ensures the Brotherhood of Steel Explosive Collar won't detonate after its removed from your neck - Prevents the Old World Blues trait Skilled from being taken, then removed to leave a permanent +5 to all skills. And many, many more things after that. If it's broken, YUP probably fixes it. Okay, what doesn't it fix? Any fixes I either couldn't get permission for, or couldn't integrate for technical reasons (e.g. requires NVSE, etc.) I recommend you download these fixes and run them alongside YUP, if possible. Mods YUP would like to use, but hasn't gotten permission to (yet) Andis-Female-Enclaveofficer-Fix by Andi_669 Arcade Gannon Rehire Bug Fix by Stygs Backwards Bumper Sword Fix by The Texan Black Mountain Neil Fix by Madae Black Mountain Rhonda Fix by Machienzo Jack and Diane Fix by MadCat221 Mission Mojave x93 by Machienzo Plasma caster fix by Kcarn Rifle 1st person Accuracy Fix by joefoxx082 This Machine mesh and iron sight fix by san_nanasi Mods YUP couldn't integrate for technical reasons Reload Speed Game Start Fix by sergelac (requires NVSE) Also, anything I don't know about! I'm not just the guy who maintains this mod, I also fix bugs myself. I'm not clairvoyant though, so in order to fix a bug I have to know about it first. If you have a bug you've found, leave me a message (here in the comments thread, since my inbox gets full frequently). If it's a bug, I'll do my best to fix it. Why should I use YUP instead of other mods? Good question, and one with a good answer: YUP is the only pure bug fix compilation available on the Nexus. What do I mean by "pure"? I mean a mod that does not also contain any new content, restored content, new features, balance tweaks, or other general non-bug-fix changes. Every single change in YUP exists to address a bug, exploit, or impediment to gameplay. No other mod currently on the Nexus can make that claim. No, not even that one everyone recommends (and no, I won't be more specific). If another pure bug fix compilation existed I wouldn't have made this one. Is this mod compatible with <insert name here>? YUP is designed to be compatible with as many mods as possible. Every record it changes is one which needs to be changed in order to fix a bug. Ideally, the only reason a mod will override one of YUP's fixes is if it changes the fundamental way the object/script/etc. in question operates. If nothing else, remember this: so long as you load YUP at the top of your load order, it should not cause any conflicts or negative effects. How do I use YUP? Same as any other mod: download the ESM, then add it to your load order. Place YUP at the top of your load order, directly underneath all of the base game and DLC packages, so that other mods which alter similar parts of the game don't get messed up. Yes, even above other mods which say "put at the top of your load order". YUP might undo changes those mods make otherwise, and that would be bad! There are two versions of YUP available for download: one for users with all five of the main DLCs, and one for users who lack at least one of the DLCs, not counting Courier's Stash. If you have the five main DLCs (or the Ultimate edition of the game) then you want to download the standard version, "YUP - Base Game + All DLC". This comes in one single file for your convenience. For those of you missing at least one of the five main DLCs, you should download the "Individual ESMs" version, then use the Nexus Mod Manager to enable only the ESM files which correspond to the portions of the game you own. At the very least "YUP - Base Game" should be enabled and placed at the top of your load order, with any DLC fix packages loading immediately after it. Why ESM? Why not ESP? A fair number of mods for Fallout: New Vegas come in ESM format rather than ESP format. YUP needs to be loaded before these mods to ensure that its changes don't cause compatibility issues with these other mods. The only way to make that possible is to release the mod as an ESM. How does support for Courier's Stash work? Courier's Stash - otherwise know as the Caravan Pack, Classic Pack, Mercenary Pack, and Tribal Pack - is supported by YUP without requiring it. The main "Base Game + All DLC" version of the mod includes fixes for the various elements of Courier's Stash but can still be used without error if you do not have it or one of the packs that makes it up. For any other DLC this would be impossible, but Courier's Stash uses a special method of adding items to the game known as "record injection". What this means is that even though another file adds these special pre-order weapons and armor to the game, internally they are treated as though they are part of the main FalloutNV.esm file, e.g. the Broad Machete has the FormID 001735e5, not xx1735e5. This means that YUP can include modifications to those items even if the items themselves aren't there and the game will process them without issue (technically, it treats it as another record injection). Note that even though Courier's Stash allows YUP to break the normal way things work in this regard, other rules still apply. You must still load YUP after the Pre-Order Packs/Courier's Stash for its fixes to be applied. Does YUP require NVSE or <insert name here>? Absolutely not. All of YUP's content is made to work with the base unmodified game, no other utilities required. You can run YUP on a brand spanking new fresh install of New Vegas without installing anything else. I want to help! How can I? Tons of ways. If you have any talent with editing the game, you can always contribute bug fixes to the Nexus. Just make sure to tag your fixes as at least "can reuse with credit" in the permissions section. Do you speak a language other than English? YUP needs help in producing versions for non-English installs, since quite a few fixes have been made to dialog choices and so on. Not so good with editing? Just point me towards some bugs when you find them, or some bug fix packages I've somehow overlooked. While I'm proud of YUP, I will never claim that it fixes all the bugs in the game, ever. I'm always looking for more bugs to fix. Don't have any more bugs to point out? Feedback is always appreciated! Leave me a comment in the comments section. For any of you who are more visual minded, you may have noticed that the mod page is somewhat lacking on images. Feel free to submit your images for the mod! Just go to the images tab and upload your screenshots. I'll add anything that seems appropriate. Anything else? I would just like to give a big thank you to all of the other modders out there who created the bug fixes used for this compilation. Nothing shows your love of a game like being willing to get elbow-deep in it so you can fix its bugs and issues. It's people like you that make Fallout: New Vegas a game worth playing. A separate thank you goes to xporc of the FOOK team, who personally went through FOOK's latest release and made a special ESM of bug fixes the team was allowed to share with me. A great many bug fixes in this mod are due to his efforts. I'd also like to thank miguick, who has provided both insightful feedback on this compilation along with some bug fixes of his own. Some very nice catches in there. Additional thanks go to ElminsterAU, Zilav, and Sharlikran for their work on TES5Edit, A.K.A. FNVEdit, a tool without which this compilation would not be possible. Another big, big thanks to The 3rd Type for making the logo for YUP. He jumped at the chance to make a logo for me, and his help is greatly appreciated given that I'm rubbish at visuals. :P

http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/45344/? NOT lore friendly if the PipBoy barrel is a must have to feel pure when playing! Since it now is a FOMOD it's alot easier to install/uninstall. However all saves made when using this mod will still require the point 3 action under Manual Uninstall. If a player have other PipBoy changers installed that is not the vanilla ones this mod will fail. Restore your game play to use a default PipBoy before enable this mod. When enabled this quest script will check once and remove any standard equipped PipBoy, PimpBoy and PipBoyGlove. After this a constant check is done to fetch when a player enter the menu PipBoy mode, and equip a modified PipBoy without the barrel, lamps or buttons. It will "just" show a screen. When entering game mode after a PipBoy session the script unequip the PipBoy and make a fast uneqip and equip of the armor/clothing that is equipped to upperbody. The reason to this is that the game is hardcoded to shrink whatever clothing where the PipBoy is mounted, and I tell it looks crazy if you watch it in 3rd player view.

http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/45344/? This mod removes the PipBoy in game mode and only mounts a heavily modified one when in menu mode. You MUST have NVSE running or it will break, I heavily depend on the GetEquippedObject function to make this mod "smooth" in usage. Updated to 0.71 and added a workaround for PipBoyLight. With version 0.7 and as a FOMOD I recommend all to try that out. It makes it a lot easier to install and uninstall! A lot of options are added to customize and the main three buttons are now placed at the bottom of the menu screen. New options are color and language of the three buttons and a option to add transparency to the menu screen. Note that the transparency is for everything on the menu screen not just the background. I consider it now as finished and will only fix bugs related to this release. This mod already has taken an overwhelming more time than I ever could have predicted. Doctor XP Version 1 (aka XPCheatNPC) This mod adds an NPC to Doc Mitchell’s House (called “Doc XP”) who grants XP Points and can also offer the player a large number of selectable items an infinite amount of times. This mod was created for testing purposes initially (I needed to test many high level areas and start a new game at the same time to make sure everything had spawned properly) but I figured other people may find it useful as when I last searched I could not find anything like it. To make Doc XP more useful to everyone I gave her options for the following stuff: -4D Storage 4D Storage devices increase carryweight by optional increments of 100, 200, 400 and 800. Unlike the other objects they can only be selected once. -XP Points: Available in blocks of 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000 and 20,000 -Ammo All vanilla variants come in 100 rounds (average) and in up to 3 types (e.g choosing 5.56 would give 100 5.56mm Standard, 100 AP & 100 HP rounds). Ammo variants with more than 3 types (12 Gauge for example) have had the most common variants selected. -Armor About 10 armors to chose from ranging from 6DT (Bounty Hunter Duster) to 32DT (Enclave Power Armor) -Caps Caps available in small or very large amounts -Weapons A variety of weapons to chose from to suit all play styles with ammunition where appropriate (average 100 rounds standard ammo). -Misc Supplies Stuff for hardcore mode such as food and water plus meds, steathboys, anti-rads and scrap metal. LOCATION: Wandering around the kitchen area in Doc Mitchell's House Credits: djmystro

http://www.nexusmods.com/newvegas/mods/54770/?tab=2&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fnewvegas%2Fajax%2Fmodfiles%2F%3Fid%3D54770&pUp=1 Logically, the Energy Weapons of Fallout 3 & New Vegas should be WAY stronger. I mean, I'm firing concentrated Plasma at you! It should be doing more than tickling you! This made me mad, but I just shrugged it off and ignored every Energy Weapon in both games (Minus the Gauss Rifle in FO3). Once I bought a gaming PC, I looked for mods that changed this. I found one for Fallout3, but none for F:NV. Again, I shrugged this off and never touched the guns. Then I bought Fallout 1 and 2 (Sadly no longer available). There, most Energy Weapons can hold up into very late in the game, and the Plasma Rifle is the best weapon to take to the final bosses. What the hell Bethesda? I understand the balance is important, but you made the weapons as bad as possible to achieve that? Almost none of the guns (Again, with the exception of the Gauss Rifle and Tesla Cannon, although there are better choices than even these) are worth taking to Hoover Dam for the final battle, almost none of them are useful past level 20. Well, now I decided to change that. When finished those games, I started up my G.E.C.K and changed around some data values. This mod isn't too great, I understand, and it might even flip the problem for some, making the guns TOO powerful. But, in a single-player game anyway, isn't it better to have something a bit too powerful than way too weak? These aren't broken, at least in my opinion, but they are respectable, they do last you a while into the game and some last until the end of the game. They have good stopping power and, at last, compete with Guns. Also, the Unique Variants of the Plasma and Laser rifles are now worth finding. The files are all standalone. None of the DLC files include the Vanilla weapons, so you have to get that file to get those changes. If you own Either the GOTY edition or the have the standard version but have bought GRA, HH and OWB you can get the Merged File that includes all of the other files. Please report any issues with the Merged one, my Merging skills aren't exactly the best and I've screwed it up before. Nothing came up in my testing, except the MF Recharge Pistol bug in the GRA version, which I fixed in the latest version.
